column2: more than  emergency siren blanket the city of san francisco ready to warn local in the event of a flood a fire an earthquake or terrorism and while true emergency are few and far between everyone in the bay area know the siren s racket even if they ve trained their ear to tune it out redolent of an wartime air raid the siren wail precisely at noon each tuesday rising and falling eerily and slowly this is a test a voice follows this is a test of the outdoor warning system this is only a test and thus concludes the tuesday midday siren tradition what the resident don t know is that their siren ha long been vulnerable to attack triggering the sound for malicious or mischievous purpose isn t stupid easy but for a person educated in radio frequency security who ha   to blow at an electronics store there s virtually nothing to stop them from bathing the city in obnoxious tone for hour on end worst still the same vulnerability might very well affect similar emergency system in countless other city university and public utility installation read nuclear power plant two year ago a software engineer originally from australia moved to san francisco from south bay and noticed the siren everywhere he went perched atop pole and often intentionally positioned so a not to adversely affect resident by blocking their view most people wouldn t give it a second thought but the engineer balint seeber just happens to be obsessed with electromagnetic radiation in particular the range of frequency most of u simply refer to a radio examining the siren installed by a company called acoustic technology inc or ati system seeber the director of vulnerability research at bastille network deduced that all were triggered by rf radio frequency and of course they are it would be incredibly inefficient to do it any other way why on earth would the city run mile and mile of electric cable to over a  point in the city when sweet wireless radio is so cheap and easy to use before customer panic too much please understand that this is not a trivially easy thing that just anyone can do with access to a specially licensed frequency there s virtually nothing to impede the signal sent once a week by the city s emergency management department what s more test signal not intended to trigger the siren can be sent just a easily ensuring that the system is on standby for when it is needed most it s nearly foolproof nearly it s not clear what possessed him to do it but on one tuesday shortly before noon seeber connected a radio transceiver to his laptop and prepared to scan the airwave for the siren system s signal a it blared he searched the spectrum broadly scanning for any activity that matched the siren s call eventually he hit pay dirt ati s proprietary digital radio protocol unfortunately did not benefit from any security measure that would be useful in defending against malicious triggering he found i wa expecting some type of encryption might ve been applied that would have yielded packet with random looking data seeber told gizmodo that wasn t the case these particular activation packet a they call them have the same structure every week he said so it became quickly very apparent that you could forge these packet it s not a simple a a replay attack he said meaning you can t just record the sound and re emit it there s a little more complexity to them but not much more what would it take then to actually trigger the siren someone with an electrical engineering degree would be ideal the most complex bit of course is finding someone to code the software needed to demodulate replicate and transmit the necessary rf signal san francisco s siren are activated by a manned central controller strategically placed within the city when an emergency call the controller transmits digital activation packet to a repeater which according to seebe is located in twin peak the city s second highest summit and geographical center the repeater having receiving the packet in turn transmits the packet over a licensed frequency to the siren each of which contains a modem for demodulating the packet anyone who may intercept them purposefully or by accident will likely only hear what sound like seemingly random tone firing in short burst a binary code unchanging week to week and the key to the siren s annoying song a person who understands this technology a seeber doe should be able to decipher the flow of one and zero and if they re an asshole wake up the entire city oh and they need that   radio too these signal can be scrambled randomized or in other word encrypted to stave off this type of malicious attack but according to bastille a firm that specializes in analyzing rf based attack for bank tech company a well a the government many company believe that merely developing their own radio protocol is security enough having confidence that you re secure simply because no one know what the hell you re doing is sometime called security through obscurity picture a safe with a locking mechanism that no one ha ever seen doe that make it unbreakable a seeber deftly demonstrated the obscurity trick doesn t always work so well what we find in our work in general is that in iot and critical infrastructure and industrial control system a lot of company decide that they re going to implement a proprietary rf protocol a radio frequency protocol to communicate and they may or may not add security to that bastille s chief revenue officer ivan o sullivan told gizmodo seeber s research which wa conducted passively meaning he never actually attempted to trigger the alarm himself demonstrated that ati had not attempted to encrypt it activation sequence likely because it assumed anyone who happened to find it would have no idea what it wa for i do see now various form of new packet that do look more random and that make me optimistic according to it website ati ha a host of featured client one might recognize among them one world trade center and west point academy but it s unclear which system at which location are similarly affected by the vulnerability bastille wa however able to test seeber s discovery at one other location the problem it seems is not san francisco s alone seeber went to the midwest and proved it at a second location o sullivan said we know of at least two confirmed location and that s what we ve done so far but we haven t been able to travel to each of the location the second location seeber informed gizmodo wa in sedgwick county kansa authority there he said confirmed to bastille that they d been working with ati to fix their problem a well what we want now is to make sure that ati s other customer are made aware of the vulnerability communicate with ati and work with them to take and if necessary customize the patch and get it out there added o sullivan said in a public statement tuesday ati did not contest with bastille s finding it did however urged it customer not to panic too much bastille network a company that offer visibility into known and unknown mobile wireless and iot device within an enterprise s corporate airspace reported that by monitoring one of our system for month they have largely deduced the command format of our packet ati wrote adding this is likely true it continued however we wish to point out these are technically sophisticated people who have devoted significant time and effort to this task before customer panic too much please understand that this is not a trivially easy thing that just anyone can do spoofing our current protocol is still several order of magnitude harder than spoofing a dtmf based siren system dtmf tone such a those used on old landline telephone have been used in the past to activate emergency system ati confirmed that indeed it wa issuing a patch to further safeguard it system at least one not already protected from the vulnerability which seeber ha named siren jack the siren deployed by ati on military base for instance already use encrypted signal the military s equipment is considerably more expensive however and not every local government will be able to justify the expense ati said thanks to bastille a patch created by ati against siren jack is now currently being tested and the company plan to roll it out soon unfortunately it s not a easy a it sound the siren ati said are not mass market consumer item connected to the internet where you simply download a patch san francisco at least may be able to rest easy change have been apparent say seeber who continues to monitor ati s protocol from his home with his laptop and amazon bought radio i do see now various form of new packet that do look more random he say and that make me optimistic

column2: mark zuckerberg is set to testify before congress this week a his apology tour roll on but the facebook ceo s newfound humility ha done little stem the flood of criticism hitting his company the latest high profile critic to jump into the fray is apple co founder steve wozniak it s been about three week since the cambridge analytica scandal broke and facebook user began to truly recognize how reckless facebook can be with their data zuckerberg ha been frantically trying to reassure the public that facebook know it need to do a better job and that s why lot of feature that could have rolled out year ago are going live but for observer like wozniak there s little the social network can do because it fundamental business model is the problem in a goodbye message he posted on facebook sunday wozniak said he s leaving the site that ha brought him more negative than positive he ha since deactivated his account but not deleted it telling usa today he want to retain the stevewoz user name user provide every detail of their life to facebook and facebook make a lot of advertising money off this the woz told the paper the profit are all based on the user s info but the user get none of the profit back echoing apple ceo tim cook s recent comment wozniak said that it would be better to just pay facebook directly for use of the network adding with facebook you are the product cook s criticism were previewed almost two week ago but the full interview with recode and msnbc ran over the weekend he went further than wozniak saying that not only ha the facebook model demonstrated itself to be untenable apple think it should never exist in the first place look we ve never believed that these detailed profile of people that ha incredibly deep personal information that is patched together from several source should exist he said in apple s view he said all of these connective data point could be used in devious way and is one of the thing that is possible in life but shouldn t exist after saying that he s typically not a fan of regulation he went a far a to suggest facebook shouldn t be allowed to exist in an interview with vox last week zuckerberg called cook s comment extremely glib and not at all aligned with the truth he argued that a lot of people can t afford to pay and facebook seek to make a product that connects everyone in the world of course zuckerberg s big idea ha always just been the internet he want an internet inside the internet and when facebook ha attempted to launch a basic internet service that people pay for with their data it s been met with accusation of digital colonialism and being a backdoor violation of net neutrality this is a case of three wildly rich men trying to publicly hash out what s best for the public and it s tough to say that any of them are free of hypocrisy in this situation but considering the news that zuckerberg had a special tool to delete his message from other user inboxes all three men can probably agree with cook s assertion that facebook is just creepy usa today

seriously on tuesday trump claimed that he sent a memo to the justice department directing the attorney general to propose regulation that ban all device that turn legal weapon into machine gun while there are a number of legal device on the market that can make a semi automatic weapon act a if it were fully automatic bump fire stock are the most well known these device replace the stock on a gun and simulate automatic fire rate with a sliding mechanism that take advantage of the gun s natural recoil the shooter keep their finger in place and let the motion of the gun do the pulling you might recall that bump stock were a big topic following the shooting in la vega last october that left  people dead and  others injured even conservative lawmaker like paul ryan seemed open to a ban on bump stock the nra called for the atf to review whether these device comply with federal law they do comply with current u law and a the nra acknowledged in it statement the atf ha confirmed this twice before lawmaker and gun organization successfully deflected and nothing ha been done now we re onto a new mass shooting but this one didn t involve bump stock but that old ban people wanted well it s suddenly back in the news and the ceaselessly terrified crowd that hoard gun every time it hears the phrase background check is bombarding slide fire s site to get it hand on the apparently soon to be banned device considering that slide fire wa just running a president s day promotion with the coupon code maga it seems safe to say that this time the push for a ban will be a real a the last one

recode over the past two week weve experienced a higher volume of download your information request than usual this mean it is taking longer to process the request we are working on it and appreciate people patience it interesting because downloading your data is a common action that user take when theyre preparing to delete their account sometimes user just want to get a look at everything column2: from late  through early  a megaflood of historic proportion put large part of the state of california underwater the state s central valley which is now one of the most productive agricultural are in the country became a vast inland lake the city of sacramento which sits at the intersection of the american and sacramento river flooded and remained under water for month according to one account one quarter of the state s   cattle drowned in the flooding and one third of the state s property wa destroyed see also parade of storm threatens to prolong california dam crisis the great flood of  to  is becoming more likely to reoccur a the climate warms a new study find a study published monday in nature climate change found that despite an overall small change in the state s average yearly precipitation throughout the th century and in projection for the future there may be huge and highly consequential change in precipitation extreme within season some of which have already begun to buffet the state in practical term this mean that what is today considered to be the  year flood an event that would overwhelm the vast majority of california s flood defense and water infrastructure will become the   year flood in the coming decade lead author daniel swain a climate researcher at the university of california at los angeles wrote in a blog post on monday relative change in percent in extremely wet season top extremely dry season middle and year to year whiplash bottom by   in southern california image swain et al  in an interview swain said he wa surprised how sharply the risk of another great flood event increased just over the next  year according to the numerous computer model simulation used in the study the study found that between  and  california s major urban area including san francisco and los angeles are more likely than not to experience at least one extremely severe storm sequence that is similar in magnitude to the great flood this is a three fold increase in the risk of such a devastating event swain said this result is pretty eyebrow raising certainly to me it and may raise some eyebrow in the emergency planning community a well that flood wa the result of an unrelenting series of storm that channeled a firehose of moisture off the pacific ocean known a atmospheric river weather system the study make for sobering reading because it show how sharply the risk of both extremely wet and dry season is increasing along with what the author term precipitation whiplash a the climate oscillates between these two extreme previous study swain said had focused on how annual average precipitation may change a the climate warms but the relatively small amount of change at this timescale is effectively masking far more consequential trend at shorter timescales that seems to be masking very significant change in the character of precipitation and precipitation extreme swain said the researcher utilized computer model to simulate precipitation trend in california during the remainder of the st century studying result from simulation including the business a usual course of greenhouse gas emission a well a control run that did not include an increase in global warming pollutant increasing frequency of precipitation extreme in california image ucla daniel swain one of the more unique insight the study provides is the likelihood that there will be more frequent and drastic year to year precipitation shift much like the one that occurred between a record drought that lasted from about  to  and wa followed by a record wet winter in part of california during the winter of  to  the wet winter peaked with the failure of a spillway at the oroville dam in  which forced about   people to evacuate the study project a  to  percent increase in such precipitation whiplash event during the coming year a the study note california s water infrastructure is simply not prepared for such an escalation in extreme event the study state few of the dam levee and canal that currently protect million living in california s flood plain and facilitate the movement of water from sierra nevada watershed to coastal city have been tested by a deluge a severe a the extraordinary   storm sequence a repeat of which would probably lead to considerable loss of life and economic damage approaching a trillion dollar the study is consistent with other finding on how precipitation extreme are already changing a the climate warms but it may actually underestimate the severity of these change for california said kevin trenberth a senior researcher at the national center for atmospheric research ncar in boulder colorado trenberth wa not involved in the new study in general a warmer world will provide storm with more moisture to work with a the air s capacity to hold water vapor and the evaporation rate from the land and sea all increase there s already observational evidence showing this is taking place but this new study serf a a warning that coming decade will bring a wild ride from one extreme to the next challenging even our sturdiest most modern infrastructure buckle up

column2: for a moment mark zuckerberg s appearance before member of the european parliament looked like it wa going to be a very bad day for the facebook ceo then he started answering question a flood of pablum spewed from his mouth and everyone got angry in the lead up to zuckerberg s first appearance before politician in europe since the cambridge analytica scandal broke it wa widely expected he d face much tougher question than he did in front of the u congress not only are european generally more protective of privacy and more open to breaking up monopoly but the eu is implementing it long awaited gdpr privacy protection at the end of the week here we have governmental authority actually imposing regulation rather than just talking about it and there are numerous indication that facebook is already worming it way around them indeed the leader of european parliament s political group had some hard hitting question for zuckerberg some even followed up on question raised by the senate that have remained unanswered since april most questioner seemed to have a better grasp of the issue at hand than the majority of congress and the majority of the question were quite specific such a will facebook allow all user to completely opt out of targeted advertising but the format that wa chosen completely screwed up any chance of getting a straight answer from zuckerberg rather than giving each member of parliament time to ask a question get an answer and followup everyone asked their question in the beginning each member threw out around six question and zuckerberg wa given the chance to respond to the dozen of inquiry all at once at first this seemed to be getting under the ceo skin a huge number of issue were raised in rapid fire succession and i wondered how he d possibly address each concern in the end he didn t you can find some form of every zuckerberg answer in his prepared remark that were released before the hearing and read out loud by him a the proceeding began the  year old exec ha had month to sharpen his skill in delivering canned answer and he did on tuesday he did it without breaking a sweat rather than respond to individual question he looked at his note and grouped them into theme you ve heard every reply before they all boiled down to facebook need to do better and we are the session went over it allotted time and zuckerberg announced that he would wrap up he lamented that there were a lot of specific question that i didn t get to specifically answer but he wa pleased that he wa able to address the high level area of everyone s concern this didn t sit well in the room various member began pointing out which question went unanswered belgium s philippe lambert angrily pointed out that he phrased all six of his question for yes or no answer and received no response lambert laid it out plainly of course you asked for this format for a reason it wa unclear whose idea this odd format wa before lambert scolded zuckerberg the most intense moment came right a zuckerberg wa wrapping up britain s syed kamall reminded the ceo that he hadn t addressed concern about the shadow profile facebook build around non user data here s mark s face zuckerberg tried to explain that facebook ha announced a clear history tool that will let user wipe all basic browsing history data he explained that the company keep tab on non user to make sure they aren t scraping data and to monitor how people use our service kamall interrupted to ask how a non facebook user can stop their data from being transferred to facebook s system on the security side we think it s important to keep it to protect people in our community zuckerberg responded curtly before turning to his counsel and changing the subject in the end no one seemed satisfied today but there wa the appearance of a promise to follow up on question in writing that promise came from zuckerberg s lawyer the question that went unanswered at his two session in congress still linger but we know that s in part because republican lawmaker haven t followed up something tell me the member of parliament will below you ll find every question that mark zuckerberg wa asked and failed to answer with specific we ve paraphrased many of them for the sake of clarity germany s manfred weber is cambridge analytica an isolated case can you guarantee that another scandal will not happen in three six nine month time did you personally make the decision in  to not notify your user about the loss of their data to cambridge analytica and why wa the decision made not notify user is there an alternative to facebook s service in europe today would you consider your company a monopoly i think it s time to discus breaking up facebook can you convince me not to do so germany s udo bullmann are you ready to completely comply with the new gdpr regulation within the next three day can you guarantee that facebook is in line with the new rule can you guarantee that you will not collect and sell any data to third party without proper consent especially if people want to leave facebook how quickly and under what condition will user who leave facebook s data be fully removed how can you explain that the number of false account on facebook are on the rise what are you doing to target specifically sophisticated fake account especially when it come to political manipulation are you ready to guarantee that upcoming european election will be free of manipulation from foreign and hostile power how can you adapt your business model to make this guarantee britain s syed kamall facebook ha admitted to creating shadow profile of people who surf the web but don t have a facebook account is avoiding the internet entirely the only way to prevent facebook from collecting my data what do you do with the data from non facebook user do you commercialize it is that morally acceptable is a non facebook user able to see the data that s been collected if not why not belgium s guy verhofstadt are you telling u the truth when you say that you will apply gdpr privacy standard because there are already indication that you re violating the regulation article  of column2: florida had at least  incident in the week after the shooting more than any other state the group said ohio followed with  and kentucky wa third with  other state that experienced unusually high number of threat false alarm or other incident included california georgia mississippi new york texas and virginia dozen of teenager have been arrested in connection with threat often posted on twitter or snapchat school administrator are scrutinizing student and their backpack closely the day after the florida attack a student at clarksburg high school in montgomery county md wa found to have a loaded glock  millimeter handgun in his bag at school the police said a student at pasco high school in dade city fla wa arrested on friday after a staff member conducting a routine sweep of vehicle in the parking lot discovered an ar  rifle and ammunition in the student s truck the school district later said that the gun apparently had been meant for hog hunting the police say they are taking all report seriously in light of the attack in florida where law enforcement authority had been given warning about the suspect who is accused of fatally shooting  people at marjory stoneman douglas high school scott israel the sheriff of broward county fla said on thursday that his department had received  call regarding the suspect nikolas cruz over several year but may not have followed up on them sufficiently on jan  a woman who knew mr cruz called the f b i s tip hotline saying that she wa worried he might resort to slipping into a school and just shooting the place up in that call made more than a month before the attack she gave the authority an unambiguous warning i know he s going to explode aaron chapin the chief of the shorewood hill police in wisconsin said we have to treat every situation a if it s real he added that police department could become overwhelmed chasing false alarm or threat that turn out to be hoax if we re constantly fielding non actual threat at some point there s exhaustion he said the number of threat to school ha risen after previous school shooting a well including an attack in january in benton ky where two  year old student were killed according to amy klinger a founder of the educator s school safety network and it director of program but the jump in threat ha been especially pronounced since the florida attack it s reflective of the feeling in the country m klinger said you have to think about what someone who s making a threat want to get out of it they want chaos fear for people to be upset that is exactly what occurred in school district like the one in orono minn where a high school student wrote last week in an anonymous twitter post orono is not safe today at   p m i will shoot up the school myself the police were called the school went into lockdown and teacher and student barricaded door with metal cabinet and desk parent rushed to the school and were kept outside while they texted and called their child for several hour and waited for update the boy who the police say wrote the twitter post wa arrested and charged a a juvenile with making terroristic threat correy farniok the chief of police in orono said the authority took the threat seriously because of it specificity other campus have closed in recent day in response to vague social medium posting an instagram post on the former n f l player jonathan martin s verified account featuring an image of a shotgun a reference to revenge and the name of his former high school in california prompted the closing of the school harvard westlake across the nation student and school employee said they were on alert two  year old in arlington tex were arrested after tipster said they scrawled on a wall and wrote online that they were planning to attack their school at el camino high school in whittier calif a school employee said he heard a  year old student telling a classmate i guarantee you the school will be shot up in three week the employee confronted the student and reported him to the police when investigator from the los angeles county sheriff s department searched the boy s home they recovered two ar  rifle two handgun and  high capacity magazine chuck wexler the executive director of the police executive research forum a washington based research group said the attack in florida seemed to resonate more strongly than most previous attack heightening the sensitivity to additional possible threat at least for now you ve got the threat coming into school and the bomb scare mr wexler said but you also have the related part of citizen being more attentive to threat people are probably recording more situation and that s creating a higher sensitivity to the whole issue continue reading the main story

column2: the new york attorney general office ha subpoenaed more than a dozen telecommunication trade group lobbying contractor and washington advocacy organization the new york time reported on tuesday seeking to determine whether they were behind the flood of fake public comment submitted before the federal communication commission decision to revoke net neutrality rule last year barbara underwood who became the state attorney general earlier this year after predecessor eric schneiderman resigned in disgrace want to see whether industry group were behind a huge effort to pollute the  million letter filed to the fcc electronic comment filing system with fraudlent submission many of the comment were filed using temporary or duplicate email address and million were repeated verbatim using industry friendly script a recent study from stanford university researcher found that just   of the message were unique and of those   percent opposed the fcc decision the time wrote that underwood team ha already determined that million of the mass submitted comment used real individual name amounting to identity fraud and that there appears to be a clear link to a number of firm involved in the net neutrality debate most strikingly many comment on net neutrality were falsely submitted under the name of real people in what amounted to mass act of virtual identity theft some comment used the name of dead people m underwood investigator have estimated that almost half of all of the comment more than nine million used stolen identity the investigation ha traced comment submitted through bulk uploads and through an f c c service that allows advocate to solicit public comment on their own website and then transmit them to the agency investigator have identified four bucket of apparently fraudulent comment each of which appears to have been associated with a particular network of advocacy organization trade group and consultant including at least some on both side of the debate source told the time that three company were named in the subpoena including the industry funded anti net neutrality coalition broadband for america former christian coalition director ralph reed century strategy and conservative messaging firm medium bridge a the paper noted one of medium bridge press release boasted that it client american commitment had submitted nearly   comment on the issue century strategy told the time the attorney general investigation should be focused on pro net neutrality group however the wall street journal reported that advocate for the net neutrality rule were also named including fight for the future and free press the journal also wrote that medium bridge managing partner shane cory the former director of the right wing project veritas project said his group had submitted what he thought were real comment but that bad actor may have slipped in cory put the blame on the fcc commenting system which he said did not have tool to safeguard against abuse he said part of the blame lie with government agency that put no limit on how comment are posted not requiring verification of identity or commonly used tool to hinder bot mr pai ha acknowledged the problem and recently told congress the fcc wa planning to improve it comment system to ward off fakery unfortunately with no limit it is the wild west out there mr cory said the corruption of the public process will happenespecially when you have billion dollar question at stake a free press spokesperson told the journal we are responding to their request and welcome this inquiry a buzzfeed news noted fcc chair and donald trump appointee ajit pai ha previously cited the number of comment filed supporting the decision to revoke the rule despite some opinion poll showing it wa wildly unpopular thats despite the fact that allegation of massive spamming in the comment process were widespread month before the fcc board of commissioner ever voted on the issue the fcc also spread lie about a non existent cyberattack on the commenting system following a may   segment on hbo host john oliver last week tonight asking viewer to submit comment leading to accusation it wa deliberately downplaying public comment opposed to the repeal the f c c s public comment process wa corrupted by million of fake comment underwood told the time in a statement the law protects new yorkers from deception and the misuse of their identity my office will get to the bottom of what happened and hold accountable those responsible for using stolen identity to distort public opinion on net neutrality new york time wall street journal

column2: paris is flooding although heavy rain that inundated the city throughout the week stopped on friday continued flooding from the seine the river that cut through france s capital is still causing concern see also the doomsday clock is a gimmick but why it just moved closer to midnight is deadly serious by wednesday the water level had hit  foot more than double the seine s average   foot depth while french meteorological service meteo france no longer expects floodwaters to cross the  foot mark at their deepest a previously predicted it ll be close paris police told cnn that water in part of the seine will reach   meter or just shy of  foot during the evening hour of sunday night into monday morning it s not quite at the level of a  flood that saw the seine s deepest point rise to almost  foot it s also short of a june  flood which saw the seine s water level hit  foot the second incident is obviously more alarming since this latest flood is the second such incident in a two year period two flooding of the seine river in le than two year we have to change we have to change the way we build this city colombe brossel deputy mayor of paris told cnn we have to understand that climatic change is not a word it s a reality study have shown that heavy precipitation event such a this one are becoming more likely and severe a the climate continues to warm due to human emission of greenhouse gas a the city work to mitigate the effect of flooding and start the lengthy clean up process resilient parisian have stepped up to document the impact of the deluge on social medium

column2: the east coast is bracing for another nor easter this week with the national weather service in boston warning that the city and nearby coastline could see three to four foot of storm surge flooding this in the same winter that the bomb cyclone turned many of boston s street into frozen soup part of the northeast are getting hammered by frigid temperature right now just  hour after a read more read is it the latest sign of the end time not really winter storm like nor easter it turn out routinely deliver worse flooding than hurricane to this part of the world a reality confirmed by a study published earlier this year the washington post s capital weather gang noted today why s that you might ask the reason ha everything to do with the difference in how nor easter and hurricane form a difference that allows nor easter to maintain hurricane like central pressure and rip roaring wind at latitude where their tropical cousin typically fizzle out by the time a hurricane get off new england it s over very cold water and start to decay jeff master meteorologist and blogger with weather underground told earther hurricane get their strength from oceanic heat forming in warm equatorial region where there s plenty of evaporating water to condense into storm cloud nor easter get their energy from an entirely different source a master put it the contrast in density between warm moist air from the ocean and cold dry air from the land when these contrasting air mass collide the cold dry air sink and release energy the technical term for the atmospheric set up that drive the formation of a nor easter is baroclinic instability unlike hurricane which form and thrive in tropical water and feature a warm core nor easter form at mid latitude and their core are cold because they don t rely on ocean heat for their energy they can maintain hurricane like central pressure and wind strength at latitude where hurricane struggle to this can lead to some very bad flooding occasionally you get a strong hurricane up there in the northeast but they re pretty uncommon master said it s the big nor easter that dominate the record storm surge for the region model are calling for this week s nor easter to deliver damaging wind heavy rain and snowfall to the eastern seaboard beginning on thursday night although the storm s exact track remains uncertain the weather channel report a coastal flood watch is in effect from friday morning through saturday afternoon for eastern massachusetts with the nw warning that moderate to major coastal flooding that could inundate road and basement and tear up beach coastal flood watch are also in effect for much of delaware and new jersey and part of queen and long island exacerbating the flood risk is the fact that this storm is due to coincide with the astronomical high tide the full moon rise tomorrow when the sun moon and earth are perfectly aligned the gravitational tug of war cause the most extreme tide of the month the coastal flood risk is expected to persist over three high tide cycle thanks to the long lived nature of this storm all three tide are expected to be in the top ten on record for boston maybe in the top five master said said lastly just in case you thought we were going to get through an entire weather post without mentioning climate change you should know that for nor easter a for hurricane sea level rise is adding inch to storm surge and making the coastal flooding threat worse a recent study in nature found that sea level along the northern half of the eastern seaboard have risen about an inch per decade since  three to four time the global average rate that make it a lot easier to get a record high water level causing substantial damage master said h t washington post

column2: insurance tech feature on an increasing number of vc deck lately on the surface at least the insurance industry present an almost perfect storm for disruption on the one hand it is a legacy industry in drastic need of digitisation and yet paralysed by innovator s dilemma on the other hand new technology such a ubiquitous connectivity new kind of sensor and machine learning mean that the very essence of insurance i e how to ass risk will potentially look very different in just a few year however due to the regulatory overhead required to get a new insurance tech startup off the ground and the fact that it usually requires working with incumbent re insurer or underwriter progress ha been slow or so say stephen brittain co founder and director of insurtech gateway a newly launched accelerator for insurtech startup that is backed by hambro perk and robert lumley in what appears to be a first at least in the u k insurtech gateway is also an fca authorised insurance broker in it own right and ha arranged underwriting capability from aspen one of the world s biggest insurance and reinsurance specialist this brittain reckons should dramatically cut down the time it take for startup backed by the accelerator to launch new and innovative product right now the wrong people are getting through because the barrier are so high he say rather than spending  month being bounced around the insurance market and coming out the other end a an expert in form filling and startup tourism we want to partner with entrepreneur and help them get to market in a matter of week in addition to helping new insurtech startup achieve delegated regulatory approval and receive underwriting support insurtech gateway invests on bespoke term matched to company at various stage think pre seed to seed funding in range it also provides desk space full compliance back end technical platform and gdpr procedure and ha ready made partnership agreement with key capital provider distributor and infrastructure such a it and payment platform once all of this is in place argues brittain it becomes easier for more entrepreneurial and creative people to get into insurtech people who aren t encumbered by legacy thinking and don t necessarily come from the insurance industry that s what this is about we re lowering the barrier to entry so that genius can come in he say meanwhile i m told that three portfolio company are already in place inmybag which offer specialist insurance and data recovery for freelancer by mile a telematics based car insurance for low mileage driver and floodflash an iot flood sensor that enables instant settlement flood insurance another five more insurtech startup are expected to join insurtech gateway by the end of

column2: the growing reality for social network is that they will perpetually be exploited in new and terrorizing way and there may not be a sweeping solution for bad actor the hope is that solution outpace abuser this race wa on disturbing display over the weekend a a horrific video of a gunman opening fire on worshipper in two mosque in new zealand went viral and the world leading video sharing service scrambled to scrub the deluge of uploads the alleged shooter is now in custody at least  people are dead and many others are hospitalized with injury but another key facet of the massacre wa spreading a hate filled  page manifesto and first person footage of the shooting that wa captured on a body cam worn by the perpetrator the disturbing footage immediately began to spread and youtube removed every instance it could find traditionally viral content spread by people sharing it from it original source and if it caught early enough cutting off the head of the snake can do a lot to slow it down but in this case troll and ideological ally of the gunman immediately began pounding youtubes server with fresh uploads of the graphic footage every time a tragedy like this happens we learn something new and in this case it wa the unprecedented volume of video neal mohan youtubes chief product officer told the washington post stating the obvious mohan said they would have liked to get a handle on this earlier mohan also told the washington post that the christchurch attack wa a tragedy that wa almost designed for the purpose of going viral adding that youtube ha made progress but that doesnt mean we dont have a lot of work ahead of u and this incident ha shown that especially in the case of more viral video like this one there more work to be done the video uploaded over the weekend wasnt unique in it footage of a mass shooting but in it point of view the gunman livestreamed the video from a body cam and mohan reportedly said that the video wa shared a swiftly a one upload per second in the immediate aftermath of the shooting youtube hasnt released exact figure on how many uploads there were of the attack but the number that have been made available on other social platform are staggeringfacebook said that it took down   million video of the attack within the first  hour after the shooting mohan is correct in his assertion that youtube is the model platform for such gruesome virality youtube is the most powerful video sharing platform in the world it also ha a very credible reputation for suggesting video centered around conspiracy theory and white supremacy for nazi what better way to spread their ideology and incite hateful violence than to tap into this easily exploited and herculean platform youtube doe have certain system in place to flag and remove hateful and violent content it can use a hashing system to identify video that match the original video automatically detecting and deleting any copy that are subsequently uploaded unfortunately this system isnt effective when it come to all type of subtle manipulation to the video a the washington post noted user that uploaded video of the christchurch shooting made some tweak to the original video including watermark logo size alteration and animation many violent extremist group like isi use common footage and imagery youtube wrote in a twitter thread on monday these can also be signal for our detection system that help u to remove content at scale the company added however every breaking news event is unique and there are no reference file provided in advance and there also a constant flow of new footage and countless variation of known footage uploaded in the hour immediately after an event these factor present a significant challenge but we are continually working to improve our detection system when we reached out to youtube with some clarifying question about how it filtering system work a spokesperson simply redirected u to this twitter thread that give the broad outline of it functionality youtube here is partly referencing it content id system which let copyright owner preemptively submit file to the platform which will then be cross referenced with any video uploaded to the service these creator can then keep track of when a video is uploaded that match their content while this applies to more innocuous material like music and film it pose the question of whether this same system can apply to video like the christchurch shooting but the footage of the mass shooting flooding the social network over the weekend is unlike existing medium in youtubes database and so it system is unable to preemptively flag it and a previously mentioned wa uploaded with different variation gaming it and evading the system in place this combined with the staggering volume of uploads created a kind of virality that is unprecedented like any piece of machine learning software our matching technology continues to get better but frankly it a work in progress mohan told the washington post because the system in it current state is unable to detect certain variation and because even thousand of human are not enough to urgently eyeball and review flagged video mohan chose to allow the final decision to be made by the machine a weve seen with other failure for ai driven moderation benign video are often accidentally removed that wa likely the case here but ultimately the team chose expediency over precision creator whose content wa unfairly removed can file an appeal the issue plaguing youtube is that troll and extremist have the incentive to hone their effort on it platformtheir content will almost certainly get the most view and subsequently the most share and youtube is infamous for recommending hate related content meaning it is exacerbating the very problem it is trying to eradicate the content is coming from inside the house in the wake of a tragedy caught on film if extremist push that content hard onto the one leading platform while also slightly manipulating some of the version it inevitable that some are going to slip through the system crack and find their way into recommendation a youtube mentioned in it twitter thread on monday it is always working on way to better detect violating content and a we previously mentioned our only saving grace is that those building the platform can remain at least one step ahead of those trying to abuse them it an unsettling reality and one that may have social network reckoning with their role a catalyst for this new disturbing virality the washington post

column2: venice is currently experiencing the worst flooding it s seen in a decade but one restaurant refuse to let the knee high water impact business a the city begin to recover from the intense storm that recently hit italy killing several people the restaurant in venice ha it door open and is serving anyone daring enough to venture out into the flood a video shared to simone sciascia s facebook page on monday show staff carrying pizza to serve customer like it s just another day at work server are seen wading through the flooded restaurant where diner are sitting at table enjoying their food and nearly everyone is wearing tall protective rain boot of some sort now that s dedication the end of the video offer a look at the street of venice which still remain significantly flooded nearly  percent of the city wa flooded after water level rose an estimated  centimeter  foot  inch above sea level during the storm and along with street and local business noteworthy area and historical landmark like st mark s square the rialto bridge the piazza san marco and more have been impacted by the flood though flooding is common throughout italy especially a winter nears and wind carry water from the adriatic sea into the venetian lagoon this level of water is the worst venice ha experienced since  see also dramatic photo show the worst flood to hit venice in  year a noted in an earlier article italy now experience major flooding every four year or so which mean people have started taking necessary precaution to deal with the water ahead of time these include barrier placed in front of house and raised walkway and additional drain added around the city a venice s  foot tide continues to drop throughout the course of the week we re sure more and more restaurant will start re opening their door but for now the video show quite a rare and remarkable sight

column2: enlarge riverfront ave in calgary during the alberta flood  reader comment  in june  keith musselman wa living in the canadian rockies when the nearby bow river flooded we were in a valley so we were stuck for about five day musselman told ar the community wa devastated the flood wa one of the costliest and most devastating natural disaster in canada s history with five people killed more than   evacuated and extreme property damage heavy rainfall falling on late snow in the mountain had overwhelmed river and reservoir and musselman a hydrologist realized that this kind of rain on snow flooding wasn t properly understood forecaster have a good handle on what happens when rain fall he say but when that rain fall in mountain where there s deep snow we don t have a good handle on what the flood volume will be musselman and a group of colleague used historical data to sketch out what the rain on snow flood risk look like across western north america and how that risk is likely to change in a warming world their paper published in nature climate change this week find that some area will see reduced risk thanks to declining snowfall but at higher elevation there ll still be snow and the increasing amount of rain falling on that snow will have implication for flood risk the perfect storm at drier and higher elevation rainfall on snow isn t so much of a problem either because there s not enough rain or not enough snow for it to matter but when the condition are just right heavy rainfall can combine with snowmelt to produce flood that are more catastrophic than the rainfall would cause when musselman moved to work at the national center for atmospheric research ncar his colleague there had also identified this a something they wanted to study and they had a great dataset musselman say we used that to understand how rare these large flood event are work ha been done on this before but this team wa able to use more fine grained data to build up a detailed picture they built a simulated world of weather system that would produce rain on snow flood in the same place and with the same frequency a the  year of historical data they used once they were sure that the simulation matched the historical pattern of snowpack snowmelt and other factor they used it to build up a picture of how those kind of event might change over the next  year the model showed shifting pattern area that currently have a high risk of flooding will see a decrease a precipitation will occur more frequently a rain than snow but at higher elevation where once there would have been snow falling on a snowpack rising temperature will now cause rain to fall on that snow the sierra nevada canadian rockies and colorado river headwater saw the highest increase in risk with flood twice a likely in some case philip mote who study climate related snowpack change and wasn t involved in this work point out that the starting rate of flood might not be particularly high so a doubling of the risk might not necessarily mean a region suddenly awash with flood the shifting landscape will nonetheless demand a rethink of flood management but for that more data will be needed computational limit climate scientist like to look at period of  year musselman note but his team had to limit the time window because they were running into the limit of computational power available to them we re up against this wall of computational demand to simulate all the physic that are involved he explains the two  year simulation took up a year of ncar supercomputer time so they were also only able to look at one climate change scenario the average of all  different climate model in a business a usual emission scenario ideally it would also be good to know what the projection look like under additional climate scenario the  year simulation is ok if it s treated carefully say prof mote that s a constraint if you re running a km resolution over the whole of the u that s a whole heck of a lot of computing and data it doe make thing tricky for region that have rare event that might be represented only a few time across  year he explains the exact way those event change is probably le robust than if they had a  or  year simulation opening the floodgate in anticipation of winter and spring rainfall reservoir manager in many region release large amount of water in the fall creating space to buffer the incoming deluge reservoir manager follow tight rule musselman explains they have guideline based on historical data the challenge is a the climate change our rule and regulation aren t adjusting accordingly the simulation suggests that the flood risk isn t the only thing set to change seasonal timing will change too in some region the highest risk is likely to shift from spring to winter in others from winter to spring this mean new rule both for providing flood buffer and for ensuring enough refill during dry period the current rule are heavily focused on date say charles luce a hydrologist who study water management changing the rule is complicated because of all the different people involved but there s already work underway to figure out how to update the rule in the face of climate change he say that work will likely be looking to this paper for guidance the flood protection infrastructure itself also need a look say civil engineer farshid vahedifard levee and dam need to be re analyzed to see if they can safely withstand and handle this new pattern of flooding this is particularly crucial he add since most of these dam and levee are old and a good percentage of them are currently operating under marginal condition there s still work to be done to turn this risk projection into useful information though it s the first step in a series of study that aim to better understand the hydrology say musselman future work will need to look at how this translates to a very local scale including how factor like soil saturation and vegetation affect the risk of runoff becoming a flood and ongoing observation of the real situation on the ground will also be essential hydrologist wouter berghuijs agrees with mote that the simulation match what intuition would predict but it s good to see it confirmed in harder number say berghuijs these model are not perfect and there are uncertainty associated with them he add that doe not mean they don t provide useful insight nature climate change  doi   s    about doi

column2: self driving car eventually won t need a human operator but what the vehicle will need is a network powerful enough to handle the massive amount of data generated by their autonomous tech in order to ensure that network is a powerful a it need to be the volkswagen group of america joined by four autonomous tech supplier formed the networking for autonomous vehicle nav alliance on tuesday the newly formed group of autonomous tech industry leader aim to develop product for self driving car that support multi gig ethernet connectivity allowing those vehicle to better handle the data overload from all the sensor camera radar lidar ultrasound and other equipment that allow them to operate on the road without human driver see also inside the technology that help self driving car see for a self driving car a faster network like the one proposed by the nav alliance can take in all the input from the road and make a faster better decision if the vehicle should need to brake switch lane or slow down in a release about the new alliance the nav alliance laid out it plan to develop this automotive network set up testing procedure for network security create standardization within the autonomous industry and educate user and would be buyer about autonomous vehicle network the nav alliance will catalyze the development of a reliable next generation of networking platform for self driving car james hodgson a senior analyst at abi research said in a statement about the alliance now it s a matter of convincing more company to put competition aside and join the nav alliance in the hope of optimizing data network industry wide the announcement of the nav alliance s formation come one week after carmaker logistics company and other self driving company announced the formation of the partnership for transportation innovation and opportunity this group is focused on the transition to autonomous car and how that will impact the driving workforce waymo uber lyft ford toyota and fedex are some of the founding member of that group

column2: between  and  the fcc reportedly spent close to  million overhauling it comment system but after being flooded with million of fake comment during a docket to overturn net neutrality last summer the agency is now planning another total makeover in a letter to two u s senator fcc chairman ajit pai proposed a plan to rebuild and re engineer the commission s electronic comment filing system or ecf to provide safeguard against abusive conduct that sound like a great idea but one ha to wonder what the fcc wa doing over the past few year if not building a comment system engineered to protect against misuse the wall street journal wa the first to report pai s letter on wednesday after being selected to lead the agency by president donald trump pai focused on stripping his own agency of it authority to regulate internet service provider when the agency prepared to announce new rule repealing net neutrality regulation nationwide the fcc made the conscious decision not to put any effort into weeding out fake comment any kind of comment filtering it wa believed would lead to accusation of censorship even if it wa only a small number of genuine comment that got deleted this wa more or le an admission albeit a private one that the fcc ha no reliable mechanism for determining whether comment are real or fake in a bipartisan letter on monday two u senator called on the fcc to investigate the identity read more read it decision while perhaps meant to protect the fcc s reputation and the integrity of the commenting process which frankly only ever grab the public s attention broadly when the issue of net neutrality is involved backfired spectacularly by last fall the fcc wa being widely accused by state attorney general of abetting identity theft after it refused to cooperate with federal law enforcement official who sought to examine the fake comment origin it is troubling that some bad actor submitted comment using false name pai said in the letter to the two lawmaker senator pat toomey and jeff merkley indeed like you comment were submitted in my name and my wife s name that reflect viewpoint we do not hold but one suggestion offered by pai seems le geared toward authenticating commenters identity a captcha system to distinguish between human and bot that wouldn t stop someone from submitting comment using someone else s identity and if enforced across the entire system would prevent the use of bulk submission while the fcc only review a handful of the million of comment it receives typically those submitted by expert and academic who submit multi page legal opinion in recent year activist have used submission tally a a mean to demonstrate widespread public interest in a particular rulemaking agenda often comment are collected en masse by group on both side of the aisle from pro net neutrality fight for the future to the conservative freedomworks the fcc s it staff generally work behind the scene to accommodate such group including for profit one such a cq rollcall whose confidential client pay for advocacy based service the system wide enforcement of a captcha system would likely put an end to bulk submission this may reduce the influx of fake comment but it would also significantly reduce the number of comment overall the fcc ha remained largely silent on the issue repeatedly dodging question from democratic lawmaker the agency ha also been called before few oversight hearing over the past two year and is one of the least transparent in recent history likely the only reason pai responded to the letter at all is because one of the author sen toomey happens to be a republican

column2: wedding proposal are just one of the many minefield you have to navigate on social medium platform and ivan miranda isn t making thing any easier he s designed and built an autonomous printer that can draw message in sand so now s probably a good time to brace yourself for an endless barrage of will you marry me beach proposal clogging up your feed miranda s sand printer us technique borrowed from the classic dot matrix printer that were a hallmark of home publishing in the  and  an over sized print head travel back and forth between set of large wheel that slowly roll the entire printer across the beach a the print head move an etching tool lower and raise to carve line in the sand that eventually form longer message it s a slow process especially for those of u who ve become accustomed to speedy laser printer churning out multiple page per minute but the result are far more instagram friendly than trying to write an endearing message in the sand with a stick youtube via hackaday

column2: if you re buried under unanswered email and find yourself constantly starting your reply with sorry for the delay do what buzzfeed reporter and creative miscreant katie notopoulos did answer your email right away with just a couple of word she call it emailing like a ceo the same phrase used in a  new york time piece about how high tier executive tend to send terse misspelled email notopoulos say she wa perversely inspired by the sony and clinton email leak which exposed scad of these im like message she tried emulating the style for a week and found it satisfying the high didn t wear off after that first day it lasted all week she applied it to her work email and got more work done she applied it to her personal email and liked it even more i am literally not joking when i say that i think it made me a better person you can do this the way katie did using the one line response to finish off the conversation or you can just use it to check in and buy yourself time to write a longer reply guilt free mac have all kind of great automation tool but keyboard maestro is easily the most powerful read more read since joining lifehacker this may i ve found this strategy essential for dealing with a flood of pr email i even set up a keyboard maestro shortcut for the sentence i m going to pas but thank you when i m feeling salty i replace the with a or try inbox s smart reply or gmail lab s canned response anything that cut your reply short next

column2: a devastating flash flood event in mid april caused widespread damage on the lush hawaiian island of kauai now come word that during the  hour period between april  and  a staggering   inch of rain fell at a rain gauge about  mile west of hanalei if this amount is verified by the national climatic extreme committee which is part of the national oceanic and atmospheric administration noaa and serf a a sort of guinness book of world record for weather and climate it would be the heaviest  hour rainfall total ever recorded in the u s see also the national weather service had to add a new color to it map to show harvey s rainfall the current record is  inch set on july    in alvin texas it would also crush the state record of  inch which wa also set in kauai back in  the committee member will review the rain gage to determine if it wa functioning properly at the time of the rainstorm this particular gage is operated by a nonprofit organization called the waipa foundation it s possible that the committee will conclude that the amount of rain wa actually le than recorded or conversely that it underestimated the rainfall total it s not surprising that a national rainfall record would come from kauai since it s rugged terrain contains some of the wettest landscape on earth mt waialeale for example receives about  inch of rain per year and is the wettest place in the country the april rain though were unusually intense and widespread causing flash flooding throughout the island and forcing thousand to evacuate home business and infrastructure wa damaged or destroyed in a disaster that few in the continental u s heard of this rainstorm is in keeping with climate change trend a global warming is already making extreme precipitation event both more frequent and intense no study have yet been done on this particular event to see how climate change affected it but other research ha shown that global warming ha made heavy rainfall event including hurricane harvey which wa the most extreme rainstorm on record in the u s much more likely

column2: deadly storm across italy have brought venice face to face with one of the city s worst flood in at least a decade leaving resident store owner and tourist alike fending off knee high flood water new photo of the flooding show tourist and resident in boot trudging through the ancient city but flooding in venice is nothing new a few time during winter strong wind push water from the adriatic sea into the venetian lagoon causing high tide and minor but widespread flooding across the ancient island tourist gather to take picture in knee high water in the piazza san marco image getty image however every so often the flood surpass normal level and become a major hazard to everyone on the island and official will sound siren to warn the island that something more serious is coming this week the flood siren rang loud from one of the  designated bell tower within the city see also earth carbon dioxide level are likely the highest they ve been in  million year official estimate that the venetian lagoon ha risen  cm  foot  inch making it the worst flood since  and leaving nearly  percent of the city under water some of the part of the the city most severely affected by the flood are the historic piazza san marco and rialto bridge which include structure that are century old city official create lifted walkway in anticipation of the high flooding image getty image flood like this used to be f ew and far between but now major flood happen around once every four year and scientist think that human caused climate change is at least in part to blame plus it doesn t help that the petrified log holding the city afloat are sinking venice ha reportedly sunk  foot since the city s medieval heyday in order to avert continuous catastrophe back in  the italian government began working on project mose modulo sperimentale elettromeccanico to help curb the effect of sea level rise on venice the three arrow point to the location of the three barrier within the mose project image google map the idea wa to create three barrier to blockade the flow of water from the adriatic into the venetian lagoon the barrier would shut when scientist expected the highest tide so far two of the three have been completed with a third one approaching completion in the coming year the project should be finished within the next two or three year in the meantime venice ha other mechanism in place to defend against the flood climate change sinking stilt and strong wind are putting venice in significant danger of facing worse and worse flood image getty image drain are in every city square lifted walkway are put in place home and storefront especially those facing the lagoon have  foot barrier on their front door or their door are lifted off the ground entirely the  foot tide is expected to lessen throughout the rest of the week so hopefully venice will have time to recover before it ha to sound the flood alarm again

column2: south carolina ha been dealing with flooding since florence arrived at the coast on september  more than a week later the situation is only worsening for some coastal resident potentially record breaking flood water are set to inundate area that didnt see much flooding last week along the northeastern coast of south carolina home to the popular grand strand beach thats because rain can take a little while to travel downhill through river and stream before reaching the ocean in this case were talking about rain making it way through the yadkin pee dee river basin which cover more than   square mile from northern north carolina to the south carolina coast you can think of the yadkin pee dee river basin a a bathtub according to frank alsheimer the science and operation officer at the national weather service office in columbia south carolina this particular event is extremely uncommon it doesnt matter where you fill up a bathtub with water it going to fill up anyway because you have edge on either side alsheimer told earther any rain that fall all the way up this far north a northern north carolina get into the basin and very slowly drain down toward the coast this drainageinto the community in georgetown county south carolina a well a the city of conway and myrtle beachcould affect up to   people in the area said derrec becker the chief communication officer at the south carolina emergency management division to earther no mandatory evacuation are in place yet but many are self evacuating a they brace for more water the  shelter in south carolina are just  percent occupied so far becker told earther the flooding is probably going to get more severe he said currently flood water along the waccamaw river near conway south carolina sit at about   foot alsheimer said this already break the previous record of   foot and it more than  foot above the flood stage for the waccamaw river which is fueling the dangerous situation in these area still an additional two foot of floodwater is forecasted to impact the region by wednesday the record breaking nature of the flood threat speaks to the fact that while rainfall tends to be localized along the basin this time the basin got hit from all angle this particular event is extremely uncommon alsheimer said were talking about unprecedented level we havent seen before and because of that were going to have a lot of personal suffering of people who live in area that were never flooded before but will be flooded because of this event this storm ha already left at least  people dead throughout north carolina south carolina and virginia it laid the groundwork for a public health crisis due to released animal feces carcass and toxic waste and some place havent even seen the worst of it
