column2: love conquers all and that includes storm jobel delos angeles didn t let heavy rain and flooding interfere with her wedding to her partner of seven year and father of her two child on saturday instead jobel and her husband jeff embraced it the philippine is currently in the midst of monsoon season bringing heavy rain and flooding to manila and it many neighboring area including bulacan where delos angeles life according to channel news asia the rain flooded the church where the two wet slated to have their wedding but despite the inclement weather delos angeles wa delighted to go through with her nuptials see also dramatic photo show the devastating flooding and landslide in japan in a video posted to her aunt s facebook delos angeles can be seen smiling a she walk down a flooded church aisle in her wedding gown even if it flood or it rain nothing can stop me you only get married once will you postpone it i wa marrying the man i love delos angeles told afp my gown got wet and heavy but i told myself it wa a if i wa walking on a red carpet delos angeles also told afp that she had to take a boat to the church due to the intense flooding newly wed and happy a can be delos angeles ha no regret about the ceremony

column2: john mccain died on saturday after a year long struggle with brain cancer he wa an undisputed war hero and a republican senator with a complicated history a a legislator mccain stood for a more principled brand of conservatism than many of his modern g o p peer and often expressed his distaste for the street fighting and mud slinging that defines trumpism see also john mccain ever the political dramatist ha always understood the value of tv comedy over the year mccain earned a reputation for breaking rank from his fellow republican he didn t always cast his vote in way that more left leaning thinker would have preferred but in his word at least he took care to show respect and consideration for the view of his colleague across the aisle those quality in particular became an increasingly refreshing presence in a post  political atmosphere that s largely been defined by partisan bickering and below the belt scheming mccain served with honor even at a time when fewer and fewer of his colleague can say the same prior to entering politics a career that included more than  year in the u s house of representative and senate a well a a competitive presidential campaign in  against barack obama mccain wa a military man he joined the u s navy in the late  and became a pilot over the year mccain earned a reputation for breaking rank from fellow republican mccain didn t see his first combat assignment until  when the vietnam war wa in full swing le than a year into his service during his rd bombing run mccain s plane wa shot down and he wa captured by north vietnamese force he then spent the next five and a half year a a prisoner of war until his release in  he continued to serve in the year after his release eventually taking on the role of the u s navy s liaison to the senate mccain retired in  a a highly decorated captain during his time in the navy he earned two silver star two legion of merit the distinguished flying cross three bronze star medal two purple heart two navy and marine corp commendation medal and a prisoner of war medal this handful of paragraph doesn t fully capture mccain s long and illustrious career it should however give you the sense of a man who devoted his life to serving his country which mccain certainly did he s better remembered by the word of those who knew him there are plenty of those to go around today a the mccain s family friend colleague and even political rival have taken to social medium to share their touching remembrance of the departed senator my heart is broken i am so lucky to have lived the adventure of loving this incredible man for  year he passed the way he lived on his own term surrounded by the people he loved in the the place he loved best cindy mccain cindymccain august   i will need some time to absorb this but i want cindy and the entire mccain family to know they are in my prayer lindsey graham lindseygrahamsc august   john mccain wa many thing a proud graduate of the naval academy a senate colleague a political opponent but to me more than anything john wa a friend he will be missed dearly pic twitter com asysmlwd joe biden joebiden august   george h w bush john mccain wa a patriot of the highest order a public servant of rarest courage few sacrificed more for or contributed more to the welfare of his fellow citizen pic twitter com ungdpheyt edward hardy edwardthardy august   senjohnmccain lived a life of service to his country from his heroism in the navy to  year in congress he wa a tough politician a trusted colleague and there will simply never be another like him my thought and prayer are with cindy and his entire family hillary clinton hillaryclinton august   it s also worth reading this thoughtful remembrance of mccain penned by his fellow arizona senator jeff flake here s an excerpt life s last mile took john to his beloved ranch in northern arizona it wa there a few month ago where we sat for an hour or so just the two of u watching oak creek gently ripple under the shade of giant cottonwood tree he named the bird singing above u in the branch he quoted line from the novel he loved we reminisced about the past of personality come and gone he spoke wistfully of those he admired and expressed optimism that such leader would rise up in the future and now in a way that would probably have him making wisecrack we are wistful for john mccain we may never see his like again but it is his reflection of america that we need now more than ever he wa far too self deprecating to ever have thought of himself a just such a towering figure so i will go ahead and say it he showed u who we are and who we can be when we are at our best and he devoted his life to service and to the exalted idea of america that wa bigger and better than him bigger than u all his fidelity to that idea and his idealism in balancing fierce political battle with a determination to always see the good and find the humanity in his opponent is an example that transcended politics and made him the man that he wa
column8: hurricane florence is our first major hurricane of the  season in the atlantic  where will it go

column2: image copyright getty image image caption this is the worst death toll triggered by rain japan ha seen since  when nearly  people died at least  people are now known to have died in flood and landslide triggered by torrential rain in western japan say the government it is the highest death toll caused by rainfall that japan ha seen in more than three decade rescuer are now digging through mud and rubble in a race to find survivor a dozen are still missing about two million people have evacuated the region after river burst their bank i have asked my family to prepare for the worst  year old kosuke kiyohara who ha not heard from his sister and her two son told afp prime minister shinzo abe ha also cancelled an overseas trip to deal with the flood crisis image copyright afp image caption more than   emergency worker have been deployed across western japan image copyright getty image image caption around   people are staying in evacuation centre across  prefecture image copyright getty image image caption car and house were left wrecked by heavy rain leaving area covered in debris and thick mud image copyright getty image image caption thousand of home are flooded and cut off from water and electricity image copyright getty image image caption since last thursday part of western japan have received three time the usual rainfall for the whole of july image copyright getty image image caption though persistent rain have ended official have warned of sudden shower thunderstorm and landslide flood warning are still in effect for some of the worst hit area including okayama prefecture but more settled weather is expected over the next few day which is likely to help with rescue effort

column2: in march president donald trump angrily denied that he wa unhappy with his lawyer handling the russia investigation and refuted a report that he planned to hire another high powered attorney they are doing a great job he tweeted le than two month later trump is making those very change to his legal team the white house announced wednesday that lawyer ty cobb will retire at the end of the month and emmett flood an attorney who represented bill clinton during his impeachment will join the white house legal team the white house confirmed flood s hiring after it wa originally reported by the new york time emmet flood will be joining the white house staff to represent the president and the administration against the russia witch hunt white house press secretary sarah sander said in a statement on wednesday ty cobb a friend of the president who ha done a terrific job will be retiring at the end of the month the white house said cobb had been discussing his retirement for several week on march  trump responded to a new york time report that he wanted to add flood to the legal team the failing new york time purposely wrote a false story stating that i am unhappy with my legal team on the russia case and am going to add another lawyer to help out wrong i am very happy with my lawyer john dowd ty cobb and jay sekulow they are doing a great job trump tweeted one month later he added i have agreed with the historically cooperative disciplined approach that we have engaged in with robert mueller unlike the clinton i have full confidence in ty cobb my special counsel and have been fully advised throughout each phase of this process since then former new york city mayor rudy giuliani ha also joined trump s legal team the move come a trump intensifies his criticism of the mueller probe calling it a witch hunt and a setup and trap on monday the new york time published a list of more than four dozen question that mueller want to ask trump in an interview trump s attorney have not yet agreed to an interview but trump condemned the publication of the list of question a disgraceful in a tweet on wednesday trump also threatened to use his power a president to get involved in the investigation

column2: don t california my texas jim blackburn a planner environmental lawyer and something of a lightning rod around here ha been warning for year about climate change the decrepit state of houston s reservoir and the peril of developing the katy prairie he remembers escaping year ago to the prairie to bird watch one recent morning he drove me out there along the grand parkway and pulled into an unfinished subdivision a saleswoman in a model home boasted about  billion worth of box store and mall being built nearby the development she said adheres to county standard requiring that house be raised above the  year floodplain the woman handed mr blackburn a glossy brochure and a disclaimer which he scanned before climbing back into the car shaking his head the disclaimer explained that road outside the development linking it to the parkway occupy the  year floodplain meaning they would have about a  percent chance of flooding every year these day that mean they ll flood anytime you look at them funny mr blackburn said it s the new normal that s not far off the number of heavy precipitation event in the united state ha skyrocketed since the s since  instance of extreme weather hurricane flood heat wave linked to climate change have cost the united state   trillion study show that for every dollar spent upfront in preparedness american taxpayer could save  in emergency relief and reconstruction not counting health cost the impact of lost job and business revenue and incalculable grief but that requires politician to agree we suffered nothing short of a catastrophic disaster a veteran texas lobbyist bill miller said it happens at a time when the people in the governing class in this state don t believe in tax and government but they also don t want anybody discouraged from coming here because that s bad for business an upbeat narrative cast business friendly texas in the loner role of swashbuckling cowboy disdainful of coastal elite don t california my texas ha become a rallying cry for republican state lawmaker and a theme repeated by the governor greg abbott who ha complained about a patchwork quilt of ban and rule and regulation that is eroding the texas model he belief city are the culprit for year texas republican promoted local control to push against federal court order on issue like desegregation and same sex marriage now state leader have made a u turn mr abbott ha complained about political demagogue using climate change a an excuse to remake the american economy at a republican gathering in june he talked about the experience of driving out of the state s capital austin it start smelling different he told the audience and you know what that fragrance is freedom little wonder post harvey that state and local official have anointed different flood and recovery czar texas is sounding these day like russia under the romanov the system ensures nobody is clearly in charge least of all in houston a bill that would have allowed harris county merely to issue the equivalent of parking ticket to developer violating floodplain regulation the sort of regulation that control flooding wa vetoed by the governor two other bill to study flooding in the houston region introduced in the last legislative session died in committee and not long ago when houston s democratic mayor sylvester turner petitioned the governor to tap into the state s multibillion dollar rainy day fund for post harvey debris removal mr abbott said he would not authorize money before  when the legislature is next scheduled to meet i met with the mayor in city hall at the time he noted that the legislature had convened a special session to ban gender neutral bathroom if they can meet about toilet why can t they meet when the toilet overflow one frustrated city official said before mr abbott came up with   million from a separate fund to stem growing criticism another official this one with the county made the point that the area around houston is a patchwork of county and municipality with different rule and no coordination because texan believed the upside of what became in essence institutionalized entropy wa that it allowed resident to avoid the encumbrance of city government regulation and tax the problem is that hurricane and flood worsened by climate change do not recognize political border or county line their toll is shared by everyone the latest estimate from moody s put recovery from harvey at   billion much of which will end up paid by taxpayer across the united state the whole trans mississippi pioneer enterprise wa in fact brought to you by the federal government say steven conn a historian and author of american against the city the hypocrisy of senator ted cruz republican of texas resisting federal aid to the new york region after hurricane sandy but then requesting it for texas after harvey is in fact part of this same history houston s unregulated sprawl mr conn added give physical form to this politics of decentralization and anti statism photo bruce hooper outside his home in kashmere garden in houston would like to move but ha no place to go credit josh haner the new york time photo resident in some neighborhood like bear creek village had no inkling they lived in harm s way before hurricane harvey credit josh haner the new york time photo many neighborhood in houston are still piled with debris from the storm credit josh haner the new york time photo after criticism from houston s mayor gov greg abbott of texas provided   million to help with cleanup credit josh haner the new york time photo one estimate put recovery from hurricane harvey at   billion much of which will end up shared by taxpayer across the country credit josh haner the new york time a houston selling point it s not new york at the same time houston is in many way a forward looking progressive city before it elected mr turner it elected a mayor who wa a lesbian the city is in thrall to car and highway and ha precious little mass transit but the municipality of houston relies more on renewable energy than any other big city in america houston ha more green space relative to paved than new york and what many houston resident like about it it supporter say is precisely that it isn t new york or san francisco or boston they insist that it business friendly light on regulation approach help account for a big rise in employment since  a report by the city s center for opportunity urbanism a pro development organization which caution against overreacting to harvey said the city emanates a conviction that people should have the freedom to determine their destiny photo houston s sprawl and it dependence on the automobile contributed to the misery that hurricane harvey unleashed credit josh haner the new york time thomas cole director of the mcgovern center for humanity and ethic at the texas medical school of houston recalled how during the s business leader and politician conspired with medium executive to desegregate houston quietly seeing the turmoil that desegregation wa causing elsewhere in the south decade later houston boast of becoming the most diverse big city in the country with comparatively low housing cost that translate to higher level of minority homeownership but what doe affordable really mean if resident have to pay hefty transportation cost and rebuild time and again after flood houston s affordability lean on loosely regulated low cost immigrant labor providing an abundance of cheaply made slab on grade single family house that sprawl on all that open land in area like the katy prairie and it relies heavily on american taxpayer providing government tax credit mortgage interest deduction gas subsidy artificially low flood insurance rate highway construction money and emergency relief including buying out homeowner to remove their property from harm s way harris county official say they have received a many request for buyout since the hurricane   a there have been buyout since the mid s harvey turned out to be an equal opportunity disaster in meyerland an affluent district where bray bayou burst it bank steve and julie sack s house flooded for the third time in three year they are among the homeowner hoping for a buyout but i m not counting on one mr sack told me buying out rich home to repurpose vulnerable area like meyerland for flood detention a mr sack note would require load of money and remove valuable property from tax roll in a county that relies on property tax bruce hooper would move too during harvey he woke up to crackling sound when floodwaters started to seep into his appliance and electrical outlet mr hooper life in a poor area called kashmere garden i found him sitting on a tattered lawn chair outside the shell of his tumbledown rental an unemployed former park employee mr hooper told me that he and his family of five had to be airlifted out by the coast guard after a detention pond overflowed and water inside the house rose from ankle to chest high in an hour he would live elsewhere he said but like many others without flood insurance or saving we got nowhere else to go photo andy and christine kahan inside their damaged home in bear creek village welcome to the war zone mr kahan said credit josh haner the new york time a for andy and christine kahan they were among thousand who had no inkling they were especially vulnerable before harvey the kahans own a single story home in a middle class neighborhood bear creek village the damn dam did u in mr kahan said the kahans s home wa among those house flooded by the reservoir which harvey for the first time filled and threatened to overflow christine kahan and her husband had lived for  year in their house without a flood now m kahan said she would entertain a buyout a part time real estate agent she advises client to think twice about buying any home that flooded hers is now one of them but mr kahan say they will stay for the time being i m not a skeptic about climate change he told me it defies logic not to believe something is going on i asked how that lined up with his desire not to leave bear creek harvey wa an exception an act of god he said then added i know it doesn t make sense but i m an optimist at least i am until the next flood continue reading the main story

column2: several year ago one of the eventual founder of one concern nearly died in a tragic flood today the company specializes in using artificial intelligence to predict how natural disaster are unfolding in real time on a city block level basis in order to help disaster responder save a many life a possible a fast company wrote in november  in  stanford student structural engineer ahmad wani wa visiting family in his native kashmir when a catastrophic flood struck the rising water stranded him and his family for seven day without food or water during which they watched their neighbor s home collapse killing everyone inside after this horrifying experience wani wa struck by just how disorganized the emergency response wa there is no science behind how people should be rescued he say disaster response is really random to fix that one concern debuted flood concern in late  it creates map based visualization of where water surge may hit hardest up to five day ahead of an impending storm for city that includes not just time lapse breakdown of how the water will rise how fast it could move and what direction it will be flowing but also what structure will get swamped or washed away and how differing mitigation effort from levy building to dam release will impact each scenario it s the winner of fast company s  world changing idea award in the ai and data category image one concern so far flood concern ha been retroactively tested against event like hurricane harvey to show that it could have predicted what area would be most impacted well ahead of the storm the company which wa founded in silicon valley in  started with one of that region s pressing threat earthquake it s since earned contract with city like san francisco los angeles and cupertino a well a private insurance company either way a live field test is imminent a extreme weather event become more common according to the national center for environmental information the u s ha experienced  severe weather event with damage exceeding  billion in  the world economic forum s global risk report ranked extreme weather like flood and storm it number one most pressing concern one concern s first offering dubbed seismic concern take existing information from satellite image and building permit to figure out what kind of ground structure are built on and what might happen if they started shaking if a big one hit the program can extrapolate from the epicenter to suggest the likeliest place for destruction and then adjust a more data from thing like  call and social medium get factored in read more world changing idea   winning solution that could save the planet flood concern work similarly but with a more dynamic set of variable it includes soil saturation and building stability estimate but also how topography will affect potential runoff then it add in factor like national weather service forecast and u s geological survey data about nearby river or tidal flow to create a model that adjusts a the situation change we look at how thing change over space and time say one concern cofounder and cto nicole hu that allows emergency crew to figure out ahead of time what road may still passable and plan evacuation route accordingly the company can also overlay map with existing demographic data to highlight what area of a city might be especially in danger if people there don t evacuate it can also pinpoint crucial infrastructure like water tank electric plant and hospital that will need protecting and run if then hypothetical about how to do that so far the state of arizona ha signed on a a public partner one concern remains in discussion with other city and is working with international development group for how to affordably apply it service in developing country it s also building another simulator this time for wildfire for too long we have only focused on how we can use technology to make thing more convenient hu say we want to bring innovative tech into the space to help people make better decision to help make those life saving decision

column2: i love a nice juicy restaurant burger but man are they messy the minute you pick one up to take a bite half a liter of burger juice pours onto your plate making it a terrible place to set your burger down unless you ve got a thing for soggy bun here s my personal workaround a hard shell taco can break apart in your hand after just a couple bite if you re not careful read more read normally you only have one option to avoid a sloppy wet mess once you pick up your burger never set it down until you ve finished it it s a fun game but once you ve won a few time you realize it s more fun to play the drink beer and eat fry in between burger bite game most place will automatically give you fry with your burger i m not sure but it might actually be the law in most state what i suggest is you take a few of those fry and lay them out on your plate parallel to one another and spaced out about a quarter of an inch this is the fry rack and it s where you should now set your burger basically you ve created a kind of grate for burger juice to fall through down to the plate a well a a dry platform for your burger to rest on no more pool of burger juice and no more soggy bun that fall apart before you ve even managed to get halfway through that succulent half pound patty the fry also act a a sponge to soak up some of the juice before it can even begin to flood your plate granted this method call for the sacrifice of a few good fry but they knew what they were getting into when they signed up there is important information and then there is very important information and i would file read more read if the fry that comprise your dry fry rack that s shakespearean right there start to get soggy create a new fry rack on top of the old one with a perpendicular crosshatching approach you ll once again be safe from juicy burger go my friend and eat your restaurant burger with soft not wet bun and dry hand

column2: climate change used to seem like something that would confront our grandchildrena distant concern now though it staring u right in the face when we get up in the morning people wade through seawater on sunlit miami street the florida panhandle which rarely see hurricane wa recently flattened by a megastorm and every year bigger and more frequent wildfire burn through australia and california a our planet warms up the climate related change across the u s are well underway even if you havent had to cope with climate related problem yet it may not be long before you have to protect your home from extreme weather fire flooding or even sea level rise to find out how climate change may affect your area check out climate risk by region using the u s climate resilience toolkit a short video introduces the different part of the website you might want to go to the step to resilience section that offer way to ass and reduce your risk for example your flood risk depends not just on your own home and where it sits but also on thing like how the city ha channeled nearby creek and what size culvert your local department of public work ha installed beneath your street or road when it rain harder than ever before undersized culvert may be overwhelmed and creek can back up and jump their bank flooding home and road in santa cruz california the city climate action manager tiffany wise west phd ha posted a detailed action plan including a practical adaptation action for resident were not covering every little thing she say but the city simple web page is a place for ordinary people to start santa cruz county is one of the rare place that already ha a detailed plan for the future ask your city and county government if they have a local hazard mitigation plan like this one but even if your area doesnt you can rough out a way to address the specific risk your home could face in general climate change expert talk about two way of addressing climate change preventing it and dealing with the consequence here we are focused on dealing with the consequence of climate change sometimes called climate adaptation sea level rise is your seaside condo at risk of looking like the castle in the bottom of a goldfish bowl to find out look up your area on climate central surging sea risk zone map older climate model predict  to  foot of sea level rise by  but depending on how quickly major ice sheet in greenland and antarctica collapse the sea could rise a dozen meter or more for now we dont know for sure when that might happen for example east antarctic largest ice sheet is threatened by warm sea water slipping underneath it that could set the front of it afloat and allow the massive landbound part to slide into the seaenough to raise global sea level by nearly four meter  foot wise west say the santa cruz plan is about the same whether the sea rise a meter in  year or sooner it just a matter of moving up the schedule she say looking serious if you look at port arthur texas on the surging sea website and set sea level to one meter  foot you can glimpse the future here is port arthur today port arthur is home to   people and the largest oil refinery in the united state here what it could look like with one meter of sea level rise that mean that if you lived in port arthur youd have to think about not only how sea level rise would affect your own backyard but also how it would affect the oil refinery and how that would affect you thats a lesson to cast your net wide when thinking about how climate change might affect you through indirect effect go to your own address on the surging sea website and see what one meter of sea level rise look like maybe your home is fine but the nearest fire station the grocery store and a power plant  mile down the coast will all be underwater think about the infrastructure you count on will it be okay if the front step of your condo are underwater check your insurance policy to see first if you have purchased flood insurance and second if storm surge and sea level rise are covered have an emergency kit and an emergency plan for evacuating in case of a storm surge but think longer term too you could put stilt under your house fema provides tip on how individual and community can build or rebuild smarter safer and stronger and a mitigation best practice portfolio million of home may have been damaged by tropical depression florence which swept through the read more read extreme rain in  hurricane harvey slammed houston with  inch of rain in four day flooding  square mile how can you deal with such biblical flooding in the short term evacuate if local authority say to longer term have an escape plan but bottom line dont live in a floodplain remember when you bought a new can opener because you thought you lost your old one what do you read more read flooding from rain and overflowing river might seem similar to flooding from sea level rise and in some way a basement full of water is the same whether it freshwater or seawater but there is a difference flood eventually recede even with climate change it might be  or  year before another flood occurs in that location sea level rise not only doesnt recede it will keep rising for the foreseeable future if the sea is lapping at your driveway at high tide it will be at your doorstep in time if you are in doubt about whether your home could be affected by sea level rise it not too soon to start thinking about moving inland whether thats a just mile to higher ground or to another state boise idaho is lovely and livable hotter summer government map can help you estimate how much hotter itll get where you live phoenix for example is expected to go from about  day a year over  degree f to  day a year by  until you move to really lovely boise here are a few thing that will help protect your house from extreme heat paint your house white and use the palest roofing you can find plant tree around your house to provide shade seal every crack in your attic insulate the attic and wall dont run an attic fanit may cool off the attic but it will suck cool air right out of your house seal all gap around electrical outlet or pipe coming through the wall weather strip your door and replace leaky window use fan to pull in cooler air in at night extreme wind hurricane are becoming more powerful and more common this is because warmer ocean water add energy to tropical storm a they form meanwhile tornado are occurring farther east than they used to and even showing up in unlikely place such a california both kind of extreme wind destroy building by ripping off roof and hurling heavy object through the air most building code were written for relatively mild wind you can build a house like this one that will withstand a category  hurricane but if thats not in your budget make your own house a bit sturdier with wind resistant roofing garage door and storm shutter a always be prepared to evacuate to a safer place when hurricane are headed for your house

column2: on my one trip to austin texas i stuffed an unholy quantity of food and drink inside my body but what stuck with me psychically even more so than franklin barbecue la barbecue micklethwaith qui uchi the half dozen migas taco and the blur of food trailer wa an avocado green coffee stand on south congress called jo s a trusted friend said a trip to austin must include jo s iced turbo drink this is the coffee stand with i love you so much scrawled on the side of the building and instagrammed the world over jo s describes it iced turbo a such our signature sweet creamy cold coffee drink chocolate hazelnut coffee and cream mixed together served over crushed ice the setting wa ideal a humid spring texas day so i opted for the large  ounce cup for   this legendary beverage turned out to be a drinkable version of nutella with the smoothness of cold brewed coffee and the dairy richness of fresh cream so i ve had jo s iced turbo exactly once in my life during this one trip to austin two year ago and that memory ha seared into the taste receptor of my brain i daydream about it often last week i decided to devote two hour of my life trying to replicate this drink there wa scant available information online on how to recreate jo s iced turbo but i began with this one blog post the writer claim that a jo s employee revealed the drink contained whole milk half and half sweetened condensed milk coffee espresso chocolate and hazelnut that s where i began testing out varying ratio and combination on batch number seven something clicked it triggered the same pleasurable memory from that spring texas day two year ago also my heart wa palpitating from the flood of caffeine coursing through my bloodstream but i think i nailed it or at the least something close enjoy until your next trip to austin  in a large measuring cup mix espresso coffee hazelnut syrup and whole and chocolate milk separately in a small cup add a splash of hot water to a generously heaping tablespoon of condensed milk and stir until it s liquid add condensed milk to the other ingredient  whisk the concoction for  second it will feel slightly thicker but not frothy alternatively add to a cocktail shaker and shake vigorously for  second  pour into a glass filled with crushed ice stir and let dilute for a minute before you enjoy this god of iced coffee drink

column2: this weekend s storm reserved it full might for southern new england where wind gusted to  mile per hour and coastal flooding occurred for at least five tide cycle but the nor easter that struck washington d c new york providence and boston ha churned up so much real estate across the atlantic ocean that high wave are causing damage in puerto rico and the leeward island the storm s footprint in the form of high wave is unusually expansive extending all the way southward to the caribbean and even northern south america swell generated by the storm s vast wind field now occupy at least half of the north atlantic according to map provided by the u s ocean prediction center which is part of the national weather service see also pilot report hellish vomit filled landing in middle of strengthening nor easter john morale chief meteorologist at nbc  in miami who wa born in puerto rico ha been tweeting image of the damage there caused by ocean swell of  to  foot that were generated by the meteorological bomb that hit new england and is still spinning out over the open ocean the ocean swell event ha been so impactful in the caribbean that even within san juan bay the rising water and wave action caused damage along the outside of ancient wall surround old san juan http t co ivoxzgcv john morale johnmoralesnbc march   one of the worst ocean swell event in recent decade is hitting hispaniola puerto rico the virgin and northern leeward island hard today through tomorrow http t co onusoroewv john morale johnmoralesnbc march   the ocean prediction center s forecast show wave that were originally generated by the nor easter will extend across the atlantic within the next two day the likely result would not be damaging flooding however since the wave height are diminishing so far from the storm  hour wave period and direction forecast for march   image ocean prediction center the high wave did considerable damage in eastern massachusetts with astonishing scene of wave towering over home and breaking through shoreline barrier it wa one of the most destructive and longest lasting coastal flood event in massachusetts history coming in a a top  tide level in boston harbor for example town including scituate marblehead quincy and gloucester were particularly hard hit a wa the island of nantucket wave footprint of the early march nor easter outlined by the blue box image earth nullschool net the flooding wa made worse by astronomical high tide and long term sea level rise which is making once rare coastal flood event more likely with column2: white house lawyer ty cobb is retiring and an outside attorney emmet flood is being brought in to take his place the administration said wednesday j david ake ap white house attorney ty cobb is retiring at the end of this month and veteran washington lawyer emmet flood who helped president bill clinton in his impeachment proceeding in the late s ha signed on to replace him the white house said wednesday press secretary sarah sander confirmed the change after a report by the new york time the change in personnel follows other recent alteration to president trump s legal team including the addition of former new york city mayor rudy giuliani and the departure of onetime counselor john dowd cobb a friend of the president did a terrific job said sander flood sander said will be joining the white house staff to represent the president and the administration against the russia witch hunt the shakeup in trump s coterie of legal adviser is taking place a two camp within it appear to be dueling over how to handle a prospective interview between trump and the investigative team of justice department special counsel robert mueller one camp apparently led by giuliani want to keep the door open to an interview it cite the downside of not accommodating mueller he ha threatened to issue a subpoena to try to compel trump to appear before a grand jury that could either spark a drawn out courtroom war one in which the white house is seen at a disadvantage or lead to trump invoking his fifth amendment right not to give evidence with the concomitant political risk another camp which had been led by dowd want to take it chance and give mueller the stiff arm both internal and external adviser to trump have said the risk are too great in him sitting down for an interview with mueller or other investigator that camp appeared to be making it case this week by outlining also via the time the breadth and detail that mueller and his investigator would want to cover in a prospective interview with the president the time report on wednesday suggested flood will belong to the second school he is expected to take a more adversarial approach to the investigation than mr cobb who had pushed mr trump to strike a cooperative tone a the newspaper put it time reporter matt apuzzo and michael schmidt also raised the prospect that flood s arrival in the administration could clear the way for the departure of white house counsel don mcgahn who may no longer be simpatico with trump flood s law firm williams and connolly said on wednesday that it wa sad to see him go emmet is a special lawyer and long time member of the williams amp connolly family said chairman dane butswinkas we are disappointed to lose him to the white house but we fully appreciate emmet s strong commitment to public service the white house will be fortunate to have his experienced counsel

column2: the news that legendary physicist stephen hawking passed away on wednesday morning brought a flood of tribute see also not just a brilliant scientist stephen hawking wa a pop culture juggernaut everyone from scientist who admired him to celebrity who worked alongside him took to social medium to express their sadness share their story and pay their respect to one of the world s most celebrated mind eddie redmayne who won an oscar for his performance a a young stephen hawking in the  film the theory of everything wa one of them eddie redmayne won a number of award for his portrayal of stephen hawking image tim p whitby getty image we have lost a truly beautiful mind an astonishing scientist and the funniest man i have ever had the pleasure to meet said redmayne in a statement sent to usa today my love and thought are with his extraordinary family

column2: nairobi san francisco reuters facebook inc s struggle with hate speech and other type of problematic content are being hampered by the company s inability to keep up with a flood of new language a mobile phone bring social medium to every corner of the globe the company offer it   billion user feature such a menu and prompt in  different language deemed to be officially supported reuters ha found another  widely spoken language on facebook that do not have official support detailed rule known a community standard which bar user from posting offensive material including hate speech and celebration of violence were translated in only  language out of the  supported a of early march reuters found facebook s   strong content moderation workforce speaks about  tongue though the company said it hire professional translator when needed automated tool for identifying hate speech work in about  the language deficit complicates facebook s battle to rein in harmful content and the damage it can cause including to the company itself country including australia singapore and the uk are now threatening harsh new regulation punishable by steep fine or jail time for executive if it fails to promptly remove objectionable post the community standard are updated monthly and run to about   word in english monika bickert the facebook vice president in charge of the standard ha previously told reuters that they were a heavy lift to translate into all those different language a facebook spokeswoman said this week the rule are translated case by case depending on whether a language ha a critical mass of usage and whether facebook is a primary information source for speaker the spokeswoman said there wa no specific number for critical mass she said among priority for translation are khmer the official language in cambodia and sinhala the dominant language in sri lanka where the government blocked facebook this week to stem rumor about devastating easter sunday bombing a reuters report found last year that hate speech on facebook that helped foster ethnic cleansing in myanmar went unchecked in part because the company wa slow to add moderation tool and staff for the local language facebook say it now offer the rule in burmese and ha more than  speaker of the language among it workforce the spokeswoman said facebook s effort to protect people from harmful content had a level of language investment that surpasses most any technology company but human right official say facebook is in jeopardy of a repeat of the myanmar problem in other strife torn nation where it language capability have not kept up with the impact of social medium these are supposed to be the rule of the road and both customer and regulator should insist social medium platform make the rule known and effectively police them said phil robertson deputy director of human right watch s asia division failure to do so open the door to serious abuse abuse in fijian mohammed saneem the supervisor of election in fiji said he felt the impact of the language gap during election in the south pacific nation in november last year racist comment proliferated on facebook in fijian which the social network doe not support saneem said he dedicated a staffer to emailing post and translation to a facebook employee in singapore to seek removal facebook said it did not request translation and it gave reuters a post election letter from saneem praising it timely and effective assistance saneem told reuters that he valued the help but had expected pro active measure from facebook if they are allowing user to post in their language there should be guideline available in the same language he said similar issue abound in african nation such a ethiopia where deadly ethnic clash among a population of  million have been accompanied by ugly facebook content much of it is in amharic a language supported by facebook but amharic user looking up rule get them in english at least  million people worldwide speak language supported by facebook but where rule are not translated according to data from language encyclopedia ethnologue another  million or more speak one of the  language that do not have official support facebook us automated software a a key defense against prohibited content developed using a type of artificial intelligence known a machine learning these tool identify hate speech in about  language and terrorist propaganda in  the company said machine learning requires massive volume of data to train computer and a scarcity of text in other language present a challenge in rapidly growing the tool guy rosen the facebook vice president who oversees automated policy enforcement ha told reuters growth region beyond the automation and a few official fact checker facebook relies on user to report problematic content that creates a major issue where community standard are not understood or even known to exist ebele okobi facebook s director of public policy for africa told reuters in march that the continent had the world s lowest rate of user reporting a lot of people don t even know that there are community standard okobi said facebook ha bought radio advertisement in nigeria and worked with local organization to change that she said it also ha held talk with african education official to introduce social medium etiquette into the curriculum she said simultaneously facebook is partnering with wireless carrier and other group to expand internet access in country including uganda and the democratic republic of congo where it ha yet to officially support widely used language such a luganda and kituba asked this week about the expansion without language support facebook declined to comment the company announced in february it would soon have it first  sub saharan africa based content moderator at an outsourcing facility in nairobi they will join existing team in reviewing content in somali oromo and other language but the community standard are not translated into somali or oromo post in somali from last year celebrating the al shabaab militant group remained on facebook for month despite a ban on glorifying organization or act that facebook designates a terrorist disbeliever and apostate die with your anger read one post seen by reuters this month that praised the killing of a sufi cleric after reuters inquired about the post facebook said it took down the author s account because it violated policy ability to derail post in amharic reviewed by reuters this month attacked the oromo and tigray ethnic population in vicious term that clearly violated facebook s ban on discussing ethnic group using violent or dehumanizing speech statement of inferiority or call for exclusion facebook removed the two post reuters inquired about the company added that it had erred in allowing one of them from december  to remain online following an earlier user report for official such a saneem in fiji facebook s effort to improve content moderation and language support are painfully slow saneem said he warned facebook month in advance of the election in the archipelago of   people most of them use facebook with half writing in english and half in fijian he estimated social medium ha the ability to completely derail an election saneem said other social medium company face the same problem to varying degree graphic social medium and the language gap tmsnrt r vhjwtu facebook owned instagram said it   word community guideline are in  out of  language offered to user whatsapp owned by facebook a well ha term in nine of  supported language reuters found alphabet inc s youtube present community guideline in  of  available language reuters found twitter inc s rule are in  of  supported language and snap inc s in  out of  a lot of misinformation get spread around and the problem with the content publisher is the reluctance to deal with it saneem said they do owe a duty of care reporting by maggie fick in nairobi and paresh dave in san francisco additional reporting by alister doyle in fiji and omar mohammed in nairobi editing by jonathan weber and raju gopalakrishnan

column2: the image above depicts a lidar relative elevation model rem showing current and previous channel carved out by the sauk river in washington state s skagit and snohomish county in the regular satellite image below however only the active vegetation free channel are clearly visible a striking display of what the technique can reveal rem are extremely useful in discerning where river channel have migrated in the past by vividly displaying fluvial feature such a meander scar terrace and oxbow lake explains washington state geologist daniel e coe in a pdf this type of information is very informative in channel migration and flood study a well a a host of other engineering and habitat assessment carried on special aircraft lidar produce visible light laser beam while much of it bounce off of tree and vegetation enough make it through to the ground by examining the raw data to see which beam travel the farthest scientist can edit out tree vegetation and man made structure that reveals hidden seismic fault glacial landforms landslide lava flow and other feature that are invisible on a regular satellite photo used in this way the image also become a fantastic educational tool understanding thing like drumlin moraine and kettle can be pretty tough but seeing a landform stripped to the bare ground brings the concept to life suddenly it becomes much easier to visualize how glacier lava flow above tsunami and other natural phenomenon have scarred and will scar our planet s surface over time considering that they re made by scientific instrument the lidar image also happen to be beautiful seriously check them out you could even say that like other type of art they strip away the surface to show thing we may not want to see a great example is the toe jam hill fault scarp part of the seattle fault zone first revealed by a lidar scan in the  subsequent trenching showed that it wa the site of a single large earthquake   year ago part of the great seattle subduction quake at around  ad that seismic event ha become a part of the oral history and legend of coast salish native american in the region and is an ongoing concern to folk in washington s puget sound area lidar ha become an important tool in confirming ancient story while helping u learn about future one hopefully before they happen

column2: activist denise oliver velez and mark d naison give advice to the new generation of student activist la johnson npr on saturday thousand of youth activist are expected to participate in the march for our life in washington d c in accra ghana israel chile and elsewhere around the world lane murdock a  year old from connecticut will be in d c for the protest murdock wrote a petition after the parkland shooting calling for gun control it went viral and morphed into a school walkout planned for april with more than   school i hope all the monumental symbolism produced can continue to help fuel the movement say lane a well a help bring some concrete change lane ha been in touch with survivor from marjory stoneman douglas high school and is thrilled just to see everyone s face to talk with them for so long i have seen them on a screen in a way this march help transfer me out of an online presence to a physical real world one lane is part of a larger organized youth effort for gun control which come amid a resurgence of liberal activism and these teen show no sign of stopping contemporaneous demand to end anti black racism reform immigration policy and the highlighting of the nationwide culture of sexual harassment continue to dominate headline in  but we ve seen this before the sixty brimming with hippy anti war demonstration and call for black power wa a key point for liberalism in the united state and like then younger generation are now trying to impact government policy to make the world a better place what advice would activist from that time period have for these young student i spoke with two protester active during the sixty did they make mistake can this generation make lasting change mark d naison wa involved in the civil right and anti vietnam movement when he wa a student at columbia university he wa a member of congress of racial equality or core and student for a democratic society this is a long distance run not a sprint say naison he say he s very optimistic about this current movement addressing gun violence one of the best thing these protester can do he say is to have a cultural component to mobilize people so they can impact company and policy he advises student not to let up i would recommend the full mobilization before the election not only am i thinking about the kid i saw in ferguson i remember watching those kid in baltimore be met with police force at mondawmin mall in baltimore and those kid in baton rouge the shell station run from teargas it s beyond fair to name the difference johnetta elzie nettaaaaaaaa march   naison reflects that his generation s contention for change went south when it descended into violence people got so angry and frustrated when thing didn t work that they became violent in way which were not helpful he s referring to violence in the counterculture movement that stemmed from a radical faction later expelled from sd called the weather underground the militant group wa notorious for bombing the pentagon and police station the group said they decided to turn to violence because they learned that protest and march don t do it one of it leader said in a  declaration of war revolutionary violence is the only way nasion doe not anticipate the current movement for gun control will cascade down that trajectory since this is a movement against violence i think that is a pitfall that can hopefully be avoided in the late s denise oliver velez wa a member of the black panther party and the young lord over email she shared some of her thought on the current movement my only advice to them is that it is a long struggle student should not to be discouraged by setback oliver velez noted however there are similarity between white attitude towards black activist in the s and now the role of black movement will never be embraced universally she say just a few people recognize the impact of the black power movement on the anti vietnam war group who are viewed a white black life matter s organizing against brutality and suppression will never be credited a the first wave of major youth activism in this generation a young activist flood street around the country and the world remember the legacy of activism is rich and many people for many year have been fighting for a better amercia

column2: what if you didn t have to risk your life to disconnect the power during a catastrophic storm that s a question many people in houston were asking themselves a they watched water from hurricane harvey and other storm surge through the street swell in the gutter and flood their home among these houstonians were engineering student jon and cyrus jyan they watched a homeowner fought to safely disconnect their home from the power grid and said it shouldn t have to be this way they designed the flood fault circuit interrupter to monitor target area and disconnect the power automatically when a credible threat is detected the ffci is built on top of existing protection scheme like gfcis and arc fault circuit interrupter it isn t meant to replace them but instead tie them together and turn them off based on input from float switch a floodwaters rise an eeprom doe a lookup and compare to decide if the threat is enough to shut it down if so an alarm signal to a shunt trip breaker can either throw the whole system to off or else switch over to an alternate power source the system is built around a standard security panel and keypad interface that support  v alarm output we particularly like the float switch enclosure that allow water to enter while keeping out debris

column2: the latest on severe weather in the midwest and other part of the u s all time local   a m sandbag are holding back floodwaters in part of michigan a a storm sweep across the midwest and great plan bringing heavy rain snow and ice flood warning are in effect wednesday for part of northern illinois and northern indiana along with southern wisconsin and much of michigan s lower peninsula the national weather service also issued flood warning for part of missouri and texas in southwestern michigan sandbag were filled to protect home and business in the village of mattawan a the mattawan creek rose above it bank in indiana home and street were flooded in the south bend area and forecaster predicted the st joseph river wouldn t crest until thursday winter weather advisory are in effect for an area stretching from southwestern illinois to texas   a m several state could see severe flooding and other weather related problem amid a storm system that ha brought rain ice and snow to the midwest and great plain melting snow and heavy rain prompted the national weather service to issue flood warning for part of northern illinois and flood watch for central illinois the fear of a rising illinois river forced the evacuation late tuesday of the lasalle county nursing home in ottawa part of michigan s lower peninsula are seeing flooding and road closure flood warning have been in effect in illinois indiana and michigan with flood watch in texas and arkansas the weather service issued winter weather advisory for part of oklahoma kansa north dakota missouri iowa minnesota and wisconsin

column2: at a glance rain from winter storm oliver ha melted snow and triggered flooding in part of indiana water rescue have been reported from texas to michigan and road have been shut down a woman died in illinois when her car crashed into a flooded ditch this article is no longer being updated for the latest impact click here winter storm oliver s warm side melted snow and triggered flooding in part of the south and midwest and at least one death ha been blamed on the nasty weather illinois state police said a  year old woman died early tuesday morning when her vehicle rolled into a flooded ditch and wa submerged along illinois route  near peotone the chicago tribune reported peotone fire chief william schreiber told the tribune that several other vehicle were recovered from the flooded intersection but they didn t discover this particular car until hour later at five o clock in the morning it wa dark we could not see that vehicle schreiber told the tribune peotone is located about  mile south of chicago flooding problem were also reported in indiana on tuesday in elkhart county crew in boat rescued resident from a dozen home along the baugo creek the associated press reported more after flooding rain severe weather next the flooding caused several car to become stranded in high water and multiple road had to be shut down the ap also said portion of u s  and u s  became submerged in la porte the local wastewater treatment plant overflowed for just the fourth time over the course of  year according to the south bend tribune more winter storm oliver s mess of snow and ice continues because of flooding along the ohio river the horseshoe southern indiana casino and hotel in elizabeth announced a temporary closure for the first time since  wdrb com reported there wa no timetable for the hotel s reopening the flooding extended up into michigan s lower peninsula where many road were closed tuesday because they were overtaken by floodwaters in the cincinnati area the ohio river remained swollen and official prepared for additional rainfall water rescue were reported a far south a texas where resident needed to be removed from their flooded home near white rock creek in dallas a water level rose rapidly late tuesday night according to the national weather service northeast of dallas many road were flooded in the wylie area tuesday night the nw also said

column2: pijijiapan mexico reuters just past  a m under a star streaked sky the central american migrant shouldered their bag and picked over broken sidewalk first a a trickle then a a flood to the edge of the mexican town they walked straight without hesitation few spoke much their compass point wa north towards the united state their goal for the day wa pijijiapan the town  mile away wa the next stop on a trek by thousand in a caravan that ha so enraged u s president donald trump he ha threatened to close the u s mexico border and slash aid to central america honduran boy adonai  and denzel  set off from mapastepec still fogged with sleep their mother glenda escobar  clutched her youngest s hand her friend maria held onto denzel s t shirt no one had a torch pothole were treacherous only the floodlight of the odd truck in the opposite lane of the highway helped them see a few foot at a time within minute a young man lay on his back hugging his knee to his chest he d smashed his ankle on a rock he said and wa in too much pain to stand the single mother and her boy strode past keeping pace with the long train of people her ultimate destination los angeles a city where she know no one it s because in my dream god told me that s where he s sending me she said trump who campaigned against illegal immigration to win the  u s presidential vote ha seized on this caravan in the run up to the nov  mid term congressional election firing up support for his republican party yet it member make up a fraction of the hundred of thousand of people who every year flee violence and poverty in central america for the united state estimate on the size of the caravan vary from around   to more than double that some migrant have abandoned the journey deterred by the hardship or the possibility of making a new life in mexico others joined it in southern mexico  mile a day escobar kneaded her shin agile and slight she used to exercise regularly back home in the crime wracked city of san pedro sula but even the hardiest would have struggled to cover about  mile every day since she joined the caravan on oct  if she and her boy were lucky a passing car or minivan would give them a ride before the sun turned the day from sticky warm to sticky hot soon the boy watched wide eyed a dozen mainly young men sprinted for the back of slowing truck and jumped aboard an impossible feat for a mother with two small child escobar s family had had no food or water since resident of mapastepec provided them a dinner of rice bean and egg about  hour earlier that morning there had been nothing to eat at the school where they slept on a three foot  meter square patch of floor squeezed among dozen of parent with small child at least they had found shelter from the night s downpour that soaked hundred who slept on the sidewalk a shifting committee of self appointed representative in green jacket decide when to rise move or sweep the street they borrow for a night the caravan follows like clockwork through guatemala to southern mexico private citizen church group and local organization offered help at almost every stop and on the walk in between since entering mexico they have been assisted by member of pueblo sin fronteras a migrant right group that ha guided caravan through the country for several year including one that drew the ire of trump in april his broadside against that caravan generated enormous publicity convincing others desperate to leave central america that caravan are a safer way to travel others have begun forming behind escobar s group looking for work by  a m two hour past sunrise the first hitchhiker reached pijijiapan far behind the escobars walked paused zig zagged into the bush walked and stopped again we ve been going so many day escobar said watching her son flag then suddenly leap to life and give each other piggy back should we rest here a bit the boy dropped down and started wrestling which did nothing to stir maria who fell asleep in second on her backpack escobar splayed on her back stared at the sky relating the many reason that led to her journey the eldest of seven child she abandoned school and dream of becoming a detective to help her mother life spiraled down at  she said when on her way to work a man she knew kidnapped her she escaped but wa pregnant with the child of her rapist a former policeman who turned out to be a member of barrio  she said that brutal gang together with m  dominates much of el salvador and honduras he disappeared believed to have been killed but no one ever found the body she said she raised his girl and had a son with another man in time he fled to the united state promising to send for her within a year his sister told her he had married someone else finally she fell for a mototaxi driver who fathered denzel and adonai but he began to throw thing at her and abuse her and the boy then he forced her out of the house she had paid for with money saved from year working a a cook and a seamstress she said when a neighbor told her about the caravan she packed fast a plastic tarp clothes for the child some soap she left her two eldest with family hoping to fetch them later coordinator have left open when and where the caravan might reach the u s border saying it will likely fragment a many people stay in mexico escobar and her family heaved to their foot denzel unfolded a discarded pamphlet that worker from the united nation high commissioner for refugee unhcr distributed to the caravan two town back to disperse the convoy mexico ha offered the central american temporary job and identification paper if they submit request for asylum in the south but most have rejected the offer no no escobar told her son the united state is better for everything police flag down ride after six hour escobar started hitchhiking just ahead captain aispuro of the mexican federal police wa flagging down ride for woman and child with no order to stop the band of traveler aispuro said he felt a duty to help that day he had found around  ride for mother with child he said escobar managed alone settled inside a minivan their face shone with gratitude in pijijiapan hundred had turned the main square into a mix of carnival and refugee camp the family headed for a warehouse sized shelter reserved for anyone with child a medical aide squeezed iodine on a woman s bleeding foot people swarmed into the bathroom many fled for a dip in a river in mid afternoon the warehouse wa stifling with the crush of body escobar searched outside and set her plastic tarp under a tree two more stop and they would board a northbound freight train known a la bestia the beast she said all around adult fell asleep exhausted but adonai wa sprinting for his third bottle of water and denzel wa climbing a tree they re a strong a adult she said no sweat then rousing them for the next day s  a m start editing by dave graham daniel flynn and david gregorio

column2: all of u grew up around tech different from what we have today and many of u look back on those device with fondness but can you recall the exact sound your first casio keyboard made or the cadence of a rotary phone s click conserve the sound aim to well conserve the sound of gadget like these so that future generation will know what it sounded like to put a cartridge in the ne it s actually quite an old project at this point having been funded first in  but it collection ha grown to a considerable size the money came from german art institution film amp medienstiftung nrw the site wa created and is maintained by creative house chunderksen the whole thing is suitably minimal much like an actual museum you find object either by browsing randomly or by finding a corresponding tag and are presented with some straightforward imagery and a player loaded with the carefully captured sound of the device being operated though the item themselves are banal listening to these sound of a bygone age is strangely addictive they trigger memory or curiosity wa my nintendo that squeaky didn t my rotary phone click more what kind wa it anyway i wonder if they have my old boombox oh a viewmaster the collection ha grown over the year and continues to grow it now includes interview with expert in various subject on the importance of saving these sound you can even submit your own if you like we welcome suggestion in general sound suggestion story anecdote and of course collaboration write the creator i for one would love to revisit all the different modem and sound i grew up using       all the way up to   not exactly pleasant noise admittedly but i anticipate they will bring back a flood of memory proust style of bbs hour long download time and pirated screen saver

column2: way back in october of last year ring announced ring protect a modular no contract diy home security system after a few delay a bit of legal drama and ring being acquired for a billion dollar by amazon the alarm is finally about to ship albeit with a slightly different better name ring protect ha been redubbed a the more intuitive ring alarm a better name if only because competitor nest ha both a security product and a totally different product a smoke detector called nest protect ring s base level alarm kit start at   which includes a keypad for arming disarming the system one door window sensor a motion detector and a range extender you ll probably want to add more component and fortunately they re relatively cheap another door sensor for example is   buck while the motion detector are   nest s competing security system pack a few trick that ring s doesn t nest combined the door motion sensor into one for example and it s got a fancy rfid system for pin free disarming but it also cost   more and that s after a   price drop that presumably not by coincidence just happened yesterday the system doesn t require any sort of contract but if you want professional monitoring it ll be   buck a month that s a pretty good deal especially because if you ve got any of ring s camera like it smart doorbell or it floodlight camera that plan includes unlimited video storage for all of em ring say it s got more product on the way to expand the system including smoke carbon monoxide detector and flood sensor ring s security system is up for pre order now and if all go a planned will start shipping on july th

column2: when it come to competing for the heart and mind of creatives pro some see huawei attempt to beat apple at it own game others go an entirely different route acer conceptd  fall firmly in the latter camp more so that the rest of the line announced at an event today in brooklyn the  life up to the concept part of the product name with a unique swiveling tablet display that work a a sort of easel with wacom pen support with countless hybrid device having flood the market in recent year the conceptd is among the more unique eschewing the kind of surface form factor most of these company go in for nabbing marketshare from apple is a tough ask when it come to the company core of creative pro but recent design decision have left the company more vulnerable acer never been the first name one think of in the category but the product offer some of the same drawing d design functionality microsoft ha featured in it much larger surface studio all in one the hybrid launch in june sporting a hefty   price tag it a novel approach to the category but the company may have already priced itself out

column2: until a flood claimed it life the  tower tylinol found on the side of the road served him well a a do gaming rig in the aftermath of the flood the machine wa left with ruined internals and a rusted case it ended up being tossed in storage where it wa slowly rotting away but a recent idea got him to drag this old dinosaur back out into the light of day and give it a new lease on life with some modern gear for our viewing pleasure tylinol documented the restoration of the computer dubbed serendipity from start to finish the rebuild start with tearing the machine down to the steel frame and sanding all the rust off luckily it look like no structural damage wa done and a coat of engine enamel got the frame looking more or le like new the original motherboard mounting solution wouldn t work for his modern board so he ended up riveting a piece of sheet metal in and drilling new hole for standoff to thread into a nice element of this rebuild is that tylinol didn t want to drastically change the outward appearance of the machine the customary yellowed plastic wa left alone and wherever possible the original hardware wa reused rather than blow a hole in the case he took his dremel to the decorative ribbed design of the front panel and turned it into a stock looking vent the real star of this rebuild is the led cpu speed display on the front of the case in it original form this wa a fake display that simply cycled through predefined digit when you pressed the turbo button on the front panel by grounding them one at a time tylinol figured out which line on the pcb controlled each segment of the display and wired it up to a teensy   he wa then able to write a c plugin for coretemp to display the temperature the rebuilt machine is packing an i  processor gtx  video card and  gb of ddr ram not exactly a speed demon compared to some of the modern desktop out there but it certainly beat the original hardware incidentally so doe the teensy   controlling the front panel display there s a certain irony there cramming modern hardware into the carcass of an outdated computer is nothing new of course but we especially like the build that take the time to make it all look stock via r diy

column2: brussels reuters the european commission sought on thursday to address suggestion in a hungarian government information campaign that commission president jean claude juncker and billionaire investor george soros seek to flood the country with migrant initially dismissing the campaign launched throughout hungary on feb  a a ludicrous conspiracy theory the commission published a report debunking the assertion on billboard and full page newspaper ad relation between european union institution and hungarian prime minister viktor orban s nationalist fidesz ruling party have soured since the  migration crisis when orban closed hungary s border to all incoming refugee and asylum seeker many of the ad feature text stating you have the right to know what brussels is planning over picture of juncker and hungarian born soros orban accuses soros of encouraging mass immigration into europe a charge the philanthropist denies citizen do deserve to know the truth about what the eu is doing commission official said but we believe that they deserve fact not fiction the commission report rejected hungarian assertion that the european union executive arm wanted to introduce refugee resettlement quota stating that refugee resettlement is and will always be on a purely voluntary basis orban wa reelected for a third consecutive term last april on a strong anti immigration platform and his fidesz party lead the poll ahead of may s european parliamentary election he ha said he hope anti immigration party will gain a majority which he said could lead to change in the eu executive continuing it take down of the advert the commission noted that job training pilot program for migrant were voluntary and hungary had opted out of participating member state remain exclusively in charge of the number of worker they admit if at all the report said the commission also said that eu funding had nothing to do with a country s stance on immigration but that cohesion money would go to country hit by migration to help them manage hungary is also under eu scrutiny for not observing the rule of law in response to orban s ad campaign juncker also called for fidesz s exclusion from the european parliament s biggest center right political family epp reporting by clare roth editing by alison williams
