column2: enlarge this nilometer at cairo is an ancient device that egyptian used to measure nile flooding to predict the harvest and set tax level scientist used historical data from nileometers to see how volcanic eruption affected nile flood and by extension the health of the harvest reader comment  from   bce ancient egypt wa ruled by the ptolemaic dynasty a greek family put in place after alexander the great conquered egypt though egypt s wealth and importance were legendary during this time it wa also a period of great civil unrest perhaps because they were being ruled by foreigner the egyptian people revolted against their leadership several time during the s sparking civil war but now scientist believe these revolt may have broken out in part because of a chain reaction started by volcano halfway across the world there s no doubt that the egyptian were chafing under the yoke of their foreign monarch the day of the great pharaoh were over and leader from the north were replacing egyptian culture with greek god and architecture but why did the egyptian resentment boil over into open revolt sometimes and remain at a steady simmer otherwise historian francis ludlow of trinity college ireland and his colleague believe that ash dust and other particle released by volcano during the s bce caused temperature to cool around the globe cooling resulted in le water evaporation which meant le rain for northern africa and therefore le flooding of the life giving nile river because the ancient egyptian were a farming culture that lived and died by the harvest the annual nile flood wa key to survival flood meant nutrient rich water fed the field and everyone could eat nile level were so important to the egyptian economy that the government based tax amount on reading from nilometers stone well fed by the river where they could measure it height in cubit if the level were trending too high destructive flooding or too low drought tax were scaled back to account for people s diminished fortune year with low rainfall inevitably meant people wanted for more and had le to lose gripe with the government became full scale rebellion like the  year theban revolt that started in  bce and the egyptian revolt against ptolemy iii between   bce both came after period of increased volcanic activity though many other factor were in play there is an undeniable correlation between eruption and rebellion against the ptolemaic regime the volcanic house of card ludlow and his colleague gathered data for their hypothesis from a range of source they consulted the historical record to figure out when rebellion and unrest took place in egypt in addition they measured social unrest by looking at when the ptolemaic government issued new edict such a the famous rosetta stone erected during the great revolt of   bce affirming the king s power over a restless population the researcher did this under the assumption that the king would only need to issue such edict if he felt his regime wa threatened having established a chronology of uprising the researcher went volcano hunting volcano large enough to affect the climate also leave behind a telltale debris signature of volcanic sulfate in the ice of greenland and antarctica by drilling out core of ice from these area scientist can reconstruct when an eruption took place in the geological record but could they be certain that these eruption affected nile flooding to answer this question the researcher returned again to the historical record observing that eruption in the th century had reduced nile flood another treasure trove of data came from careful record of flood level measured by keeper of the islamic nilometer between   ce by analyzing this data ludlow and his colleague were able to model how much a given eruption would affect the nile s annual flood cycle the researcher found a clear connection between volcanic aerosol level in the atmosphere and weak nile flooding university of hawaii classicist robert littman who wa not involved in the study urged caution when looking at flood level he s studied nilometers extensively and noted that fluctuation in the level of the nile would have varied greatly from region to region we have text that say  cubit is the ideal level in luxor but in the north in the delta it s seven cubit so there s no guarantee that an eruption would have affected all area in egypt the same way littman added that we also can t discount political pressure such a ongoing war in syria a catalyst for revolt ludlow agreed with littman that poor flood season were just one part cause for social unrest he acknowledged the revolt were the result of many condition that happened to coalesce at the right time these include ethnic tension with some resentment bubbling away among the native egyptian populace against the new greek elite ruling egypt after alexander the great s conquest combined with economic policy enacted by the ptolemy such a the decision to move to a great focus on free threshing wheat a opposed to other grain that were le vulnerable to drought because this wa the favorite bread grain in the greek world and could be exported for greater profit but he added the low flood level could be a tipping point we frame the volcanic eruption and the associated failure of the nile summer floodwaters a trigger because their impact occurs suddenly without warning there may be decade without a major volcanic eruption but then one or more suddenly occurs he explained via email another way of putting it is that you could consider ethic tension and economic stress a a chronic contribution or cause while the sudden and short term shock from a volcanic eruption is an acute contribution of cause in other word the already troubled egyptian polity wa teetering on the brink the abrupt reversal of fortune caused by bad flood season pushed them over into armed rebellion climate and future social problem there are interesting exception during the  and  bce egypt suffered greatly from reduced flooding and it attendant peril like mass starvation plague and inflation but queen cleopatra the last of the ptolemy managed to quell revolt she did it ludlow said by offering grain relief from state granary and banning export of grain volcano induced revolt were not inevitable good public policy could make up for environmental disaster ludlow and his colleague say the climate history of the nile offer a lesson to city coping with disaster today yale environmental scientist and study co author jennifer marlon noted that it is very rare in science and history to have such strong and detailed evidence documenting how society responded to climatic shock in the past uc berkeley public policy professor solomon hsiang who wa not involved in the study ha spent most of his career showing correlation between natural disaster and long term socio economic problem over the past several year he s worked with the global policy lab to show that disaster caused by climate change such a typhoon and wildfire can lead to economic downturn from which nation may never recover still speaking at a recent conference hsiang said these study should make u hopeful this is the first time in human history when we have the technology to look ahead at what might come down the road he mused in past society leader relied on fortune teller to make decision we have data and science and analytics that allow u to see what s coming more clearly so we can make informed decision nature communication  doi   s   y about doi

prerequisite for vr game even if player don t actually use the feature the company actually found that  of apex construct player used the feature

column2: thelonious monk th birthday in  brought a flood of tribute but the most monumental statement of devotion came a year late across six disc the guitarist mile okazaki cover every known monk composition honoring the composer crooked style and getting his guitar to sound just a resonant and embodied a monk piano did is it a brilliantly assembled suite of composition for trio or a loose  minute improvisation either way it low dark and beautiful and it feel like a guarantee that well be talking about the pianist sam harris for a long time three master of improvising minimalism the drummer andrew cyrille the trumpeter wadada leo smith and the guitarist bill frisell convene for the first time mr smith make a humongous impact wherever he go and this album also work a a cooler companion to his own  album najwa where he wa surrounded by four guitar and two percussionist on this duo album james brandon lewis honor john coltrane by isolating part of his composition diving into the source material with strident ennobled conviction whether charging on the drum set or playing the hypnotic mbira chad taylor know where to find mr lewis at his best

column2: a renewable energy continues to gobble up more and more of the new energy capacity coming online the solar project lending company wunder capital ha raised   million in primarily debt financing to boost it business the  debt and  equity commitment came from the multi strategy investment firm cyrus investment which ha backed renewable energy project for year through it investment in repower group the debt component is going to blow out the lending opportunity say wunder chief executive bryan birsic wunder chose to consolidate the debt and equity round with a single lead investor to simplify the negotiation process on both side of the table birsic said since cyrus is an equity holder in the company we can come to better term on debt facility and repayment he said wunder lends money to commercial solar energy development project throughout the u s and it business ha been buoyed by a flood of demand for new solar energy project coming online since it launch in  the company ha financed over  project throughout the u s which are generating somewhere in the range of  megawatt or enough electricity to power roughly   home the boulder colo based company make money in three way it charge closing fee a servicing fee and annual interest rate on the debt it provides typically wunder will pull in between  and  off of each loan it provides to a project and business for renewable energy is booming for instance the industry appears to have shaken off concern over price increase stemming from the tariff imposed on solar panel a part of broad punitive measure president trump ha taken against china which supply most of the world s solar panel it wa really pleasant to see that folk were le reactionary and more responsive to the data say birsic the headline birsic explains were worse than the reality for the industry the headline in january predicted a  tariff on solar panel but bank thought those increase would ultimately result in a  price increase for residential solar installation and a  price increase for commercial solar those price increase would only bring cost in line with what they were at the end of  since over the course of the year price on installation declined  brisic say we re very cool with the economics a it existed in  he said

column2: scientist say the coral reef off australia s christmas island appears to be dying the scientist say that if the reef doesn t thrive neither will local fish which are a major food and income source for the island population april  ap just  mile off cuba s shore lie the healthiest coral reef system in the caribbean dubbed jardines de la reina garden of the queen by columbus in  the vast reef system ha thrived photo bbc earth and giant screen film coral reef aren t just pretty to look at they also act a a natural flood protection barrier from powerful ocean storm but with reef in danger around the world much of this valuable flood protection could be lost a study released tuesday pinpoint the value of coral reef finding coastal flood related damage around the world would be twice what they are now if not for this natural flood barrier on average the entire planet s coral reef are worth some  billion annually in flood protection said study lead author michael beck a scientist at the nature conservancy and a professor at the university of california santa cruz closer to home he said the united state receives nearly   million annually in direct flood reduction benefit from it reef the u s rank th globally in term of annual reef benefit to people and property in place such a florida hawaii puerto rico the u s virgin island and guam the country with the most to gain from reef conservation and restoration are indonesia the philippine malaysia mexico and cuba per caput the study found reef provide the most benefit to small island state including the cayman island belize grenada cuba bahamas jamaica and the philippine more coral reef under siege frequency of bleaching ha increased almost fivefold since the  more coral reef at severe risk a world s ocean become more acidic more great barrier reef ha survived  near death event but scientist unsure of it future the devastating damage from recent tropical cyclone such a hurricane irma and maria and typhoon haiyan would have been much worse without coral reef the study found coral reef are best at protecting coast from the biggest wave during powerful storm unfortunately we are already losing the height and complexity of shallow reef around the world so we are likely already seeing increase in flood damage along many tropical coastline beck said our national economy are normally only valued by how much we take from nature for the first time we can now value what every national economy gain in flood saving by conserving it coral reef every year globally coral reef face many threat including coastal development sand and coral mining destructive and excessive fishing storm and climate related bleaching event overall the frequency of severe coral bleaching event ha increased nearly fivefold in the past four decade from once every  to  year in the early s to once every six year in  a study published earlier this year found tuesday s study add to a growing body of research that calculates the monetary value of asset and service that nature provides u for free agence france presse reported mangrove forest for example also protect against storm surge and serve a nursery for dozen of aquatic specie they are disappearing at the rate of  to  each year scientist say in addition bee population that pollinate ten of billion of dollar worth of crop each year are collapsing afp said coral reef are living ecosystem that can recover if they are well managed and this study identifies why and where we should find the needed support for restoration and management beck said it is our hope that this science will lead to action and greater stewardship of reef around the world tuesday s study appeared in the peer reviewed british journal nature communication last slide next slide read or share this story http usat ly mkzvhu

column2: the case began after north carolina election official ran an audit that found  felon had voted improperly in the  election while most local prosecutor did not pursue these case mr nadolski decided to file felony charge we want to maintain the integrity of the voting system mr nadolski said most of the voter did not know one another before the prosecution but a they attended court together and a their story spread through this conservative county people started referring to them a one the alamance  activist have protested outside the county courthouse and asked supporter to flood the district attorney s office with letter and phone call on the defendant behalf whitney brown  said that no judge lawyer or probation officer ever told her that she had temporarily lost her right to vote after she pleaded guilty to a  charge of writing bad check her sentence did not include prison time by november  she wa complying with her probation and focused on moving ahead with her life caring for her two son who are now  and  year old and taking online class to become a medical receptionist so when her mother invited her to come with her to vote for president m brown said she did so without a second thought month later she got a letter from state election official telling her she appeared to have voted illegally my heart dropped she said
column8: puerto rican storm victim get her power back  nearly a year after hurricane maria

column2: on august  at   pm a  year old moonlighting meteorologist named eric berger wa nearly finished writing a post for his houston centric blog space city weather titled harvey late night some final thursday thought he wa in his home office he had just poured himself a glass of cabernet he had been looking at the online forecast from the national hurricane center and agreed with their essential conclusion harvey wa a well organized storm that would land with hurricane force on the texas gulf coast somewhere between corpus christi and port o connor berger also backed the center s belief that the wind would be strong in houston that weekend perhaps more than  mile per hour but he wa far more worried about the rain the unanswered question is what happens to harvey once it reach the coast berger wrote where will it go and will it go fast enough houston s rainfall total over the next five day depend on this and we just don t know the considerable majority of modern weather forecasting is aided by computer algorithm most hurricane tracking relies on data crunched by various public and private computer model and the model which take different variable temperature moisture mass and consider them in different way are not always in agreement the national hurricane center take input from several model to make it prediction averaging out their difference in part because it face the tallest order in hurricane forecasting it must say that the hurricane will go here so must television meteorologist one of the center s principal conduit to a concerned public tv too demand a singular answer berger doesn t have to draw a line he is a certified meteorologist but the weather is just a particularly absorbing hobby of his his primary paying gig is writing about aerospace for ar technica a site owned by wired medium group and he blog about the weather in his free time that give him two luxury that most front line meteorologist don t have he can value certain model and their ensemble much more heavily than others untangling a many a  different version of each forecast and he can also admit doubt he can explore the subtlety of the weather marveling at it mystery the way he ha for his small but loyal community of reader for year but especially since he established his site in october  berger doe not generate his forecast from scratch pointing his licked finger into the wind and taking reading from the galileo thermometer on his windowsill he really doe have a galileo thermometer on his windowsill but he work out of a home office that he hasn t otherwise bothered to decorate with a basic pc and a single monitor on which he toggle between tab from forecast to conflicting forecast in houston that evening the u government forecast called for about  inch of rain by then berger had already begun to wonder there is one model he ha come to trust and rely on more than any other the european centre for medium range weather forecast integrated forecasting system more popularly known in the u a the european model funded by  eu member and  cooperating state the european model is sometimes shockingly accurate in part because it s so well financed and it computing power is stronger than most with harvey it suggested that the storm would stall over houston dumping  inch of rain or more before eventually moving on that synced with berger s own analysis of the weather pattern in the atmosphere he detected a troublesome absence of steering current the force that push hurricane to wherever they re headed next and without those current the european model s forecast of a stall made a lot of sense given the sum of the evidence before him berger felt confident in one fearsome prediction and he wrote a much big time flood are coming to texas it wa at it essence an informed gut call and berger thought carefully about what he would write next he had made his reputation such a it wa for a leisure time meteorologist with a city specific weather blog by refusing to submit to the hysterical frenzy that competent weather observer dismiss a storm porn he is by nature a fairly skeptical person his twin passion space and the weather share long history of broken promise and unmet expectation his site s motto is hype free forecast for greater houston mindful of the chaotic and ultimately unnecessary evacuation prompted by hurricane rita in  i am not going to sugar coat this my friend he had written in advance of that storm a a houston resident and property owner i am truly mortified right now rita and berger had both missed but underplaying weather of dire consequence could lead to a different kind of calamity for his reader james spann alabama s longtime weather forecaster of choice had infamously botched that state s ice storm of january  spann had predicted a dusting of snow and unworried commuter headed out on the road when that dusting turned out to be a thick layer of ice spann shouldered much of the blame for the thousand of people who ended up stranded in their car school and workplace overnight berger despises alarmism in all it form he also didn t want to bear responsibility for child drowning in their attic berger s wife amanda wa getting their own two daughter ready for bed in their league city apartment temporary accommodation while the family build their dream home in nearby clear creek his dog bonnie a maltese poodle cross who dislike all men but him kept her usual vigilant watch berger can be painfully shy now he felt possessed by an unusual authority exercised remotely through the digitally transmitted written word he took another sip of his wine and returned to his keyboard certainly the corpus christi area and point immediately north and west of there will get too much rain he wrote flooding will spread to other part of texas too quite possibly houston but right now we can t say that for certain a i ve said it s either going to be pretty bad or really really bad here he posted his piece his site normally averaged somewhere between   and   view a day that particular entry received   over the next  hour a shocked berger surmised that his core reader were recommending him to their suddenly weather concerned friend he had become the center of a kind of storm within the storm in the comment one reader asked what berger thought the rainfall total might be in san antonio  mile to the west someone else asked about colorado county and another about the neighborhood near ellington field another reader wondered whether her husband s flight out of hobby airport on saturday morning might be delayed a man named petey james pointed out that saturday night wa the night of the big fight between floyd mayweather and conor mcgregor and he wanted to know whether he should risk going to the local bar or pay to watch it at home a woman named deb walter asked whether she should still have the party she had planned to host near dacus on saturday afternoon i d press ahead at this point berger wrote to her obviously if thing turn ugly saturday morning you ll have to cancel the following morning friday august  it started to rain a few drop at first and then a fairly steady shower harvey s leading edge had come to town and the model constantly updated began to align harvey wa nearly laser precise in it construction and massive and it wa also a slow mover the rain wa going to be measured in foot not inch berger sat down at his desk no wine this time and wrote another post a very serious flooding situation is coming he wrote he wrote it two more time for emphasis a very serious flooding situation is coming a very serious flooding situation is coming it wa   pm he hoped deb walter had canceled her party million turned to berger s space city weather blog during the storm since  there have been more than  weather and climate event in the united state that have each caused more than  billion in damage three principal national body are charged with predicting their arrival and effect the storm prediction center in norman oklahoma keep watch for tornado the weather prediction center in college park maryland monitor heavy rain and the national hurricane center in miami mind hurricane they have been busy in the case of harvey all three were involved funneling their best information to the houston branch of the national weather service one of it  field office across the country each help turn national forecast into finely tuned local one the houston office is the only one that share space with it home county s office of emergency management galveston county in it case better to coordinate their shared response it is no accident that their building sits atop a mound and that their office are on the upper floor over the past few decade greater houston ha grown exponentially from a mosquito plagued oil port into the fifth largest metro area in the united state home to nearly  million people that population explosion combined with a certain regional antipathy toward civic oversight ha seen former swamp turned into sprawling unregulated development houston ha been built to flood dan reilly  is the local warning coordination meteorologist part of the national weather service s round the clock professional staff in a catastrophe prone city like his the job is twofold the first is the forecast when something bad is coming that s really when we need to be at the top of our game he say of the three most damaging effect of hurricane wind storm surge and rain rain is one of the most difficult to quantify in advance the heaviest rain typically fall in small pocket and that level of precision is difficult to attain more than six to  hour ahead of it arrival houston s physical size also make rain forecast challenging each side of the i  for instance one of several highway that serve a boundary in an otherwise endless city might receive a substantially different amount a good meteorologist is almost always by definition skilled at pattern recognition weather like the law is built on a foundation of similar case veteran meteorologist reilly ha been in the job for  year mine their memory for analogue in the early hour of harvey reilly s team began upping the national weather service s rain forecast to amount that no one had ever seen  inch  and eventually  over a widespread swath of houston reilly set aside everything he knew about the weather and decided to obey the combination of awe and dread he felt in his chest a killing flood wa on it way somehow the warning sounded different coming from him the next part of the job and perhaps the more important one is getting the word out at a time when the weather can be more extreme than ever and trust in government is low convincing people to heed your warning especially the most severe of them might now be the weather forecaster s harder task the most serious warning when it come to rain is called a flash flood emergency and before harvey the houston office had issued that warning on only three occasion it would soon be used for a fourth berger sitting behind his spartan desk that afternoon anxiety beginning to weigh on him like heat wa first among those who might listen and to whom others might listen about the coming storm he wasn t the government he wa a human being and somehow the warning sounded different to their ear coming from him the kind of measured voice that shine through in a crisis after he had written his ominous flood forecast three time he looked out his office window at one of the two garage he keep one of them wa bursting with new thing for his new house and he began ferrying box upstairs to his office filling the space in front of his desk with new light fixture a microwave and a tub in between trip he heard amanda making arrangement to take shelter with their daughter at her sister s house built on piling and tucked away from the wind berger would stay he would hunker down behind his wall of box with his pc and his reader now numbering in the hundred of thousand for the duration of the storm he knew that his city wa in serious trouble and he felt an almost spiritual need to convince his neighbor that it wa time for them to share his fear the weather started making an impression on berger in  when tropical storm allison came to town berger is from michigan but had gone to the university of texas to earn his astronomy degree he moved to houston for a girl first working weekend at the houston chronicle before becoming the paper s designated sciguy writing mostly about physic chemistry and astronomy he also wrote a little about the weather he had just bought his first house near white oak bayou on june  a friday night what wa it about storm and friday night he went out with some friend to see a bob schneider concert allison had passed through houston once already but now it returned to take a second run at the city berger remembers that the sound of the rain on the roof drowned out schneider a though there wa too much percussion in the mix after the concert he and his friend left to wander around midtown gawking at the water rising on the empty street berger wrote about the storm one of his story about the drowning death of ten of thousand of research animal in the basement of the texas medical center drew massive national readership he began having vision he saw a place for thoughtful written analysis of the weather online his discussion could be more timely and interactive than the forecast printed in the paper itself and unlike tv meteorologist he needn t worry about rating or being available to viewer only at certain designated time in june  he started his own blog on the chronicle s site he didn t yet have any meteorological training he wa just someone who liked talking about the weather his colleague called him weather boy it wa not a compliment three month later came katrina then came rita and three year later hurricane ike berger s life could seem governed by storm even his first meeting with amanda whom he married in  came only a few week after allison s transformative rain he convinced the newspaper to put him through a distance learning program at mississippi state to earn his certification a a professional meteorologist modern technology and information dissemination have led to a democratization of weather forecasting and that could mean compounding disaster in the wrong hand berger wanted to make sure his hand were the right one when he left the chronicle to join ar technica in october of  he started space city weather the day after he opened up shop the remnant of hurricane patricia began clouding the sky of houston he wa supposed to go out for dinner with amanda he worried his reader would feel he d abandoned them in a time of need and he couldn t help writing a post his first forecast on space city weather wa for a flood now in august  the rain on harvey s opening night shocked even him they were biblical rain falling at a rate of  inch an hour would force most driver to pull over harvey would sometimes drop  it didn t look like water it looked like milk worse berger studied the model and the satellite imagery and if he knew anything in that moment listening to the rain against his window he knew that there wa so much more to come on saturday august  an hour after sunset the evening s first band of precipitation which on radar resembled the longest tentacle of an angry squid opened up over houston slowly crossing the city from west to east a predicted by the european model it stalled additional band trailing behind it intensified and merged with the first this created what meteorologist properly call a seething nexus of hate berger later wrote the now combined band extended more than  mile over galveston and deep into the too warm water of the gulf creating a superhighway for rain to be delivered directly to houston by very early sunday morning harvey s enormous size began to tell and another band prepared to make it assault on the already flooded southern suburb the houston branch of the nw had issued it special emergency bulletin and in the adjacent office of emergency management the wall were being papered with call for water rescue people were drowning in the rain a sleepless berger sat down at his desk and began writing a new post amanda and their daughter had been at her sister s house for several hour and she texted him to ask if he thought the latest band would be the end of it he inserted the scene into his piece which went up at   am on sunday morning i wanted nothing more than to fall in her arm and tell her yes this wa it by god yes let s go to bed and forget this ever happened it had to be it surely it would not be it harvey would make true berger s most pessimistic projection and refuse to leave he would tell his reader that the rain would continue especially at night he would later hear that administrator at the houston methodist hospital and baylor college of medicine were among those looking to him for guidance he would harbor a guilt for delivering bad news for so many at   pm on sunday berger finished writing a post that he titled houston we will get through this with the prospect of more rain you may feel hopeless or helpless or both from a mental health standpoint the uncertainty this brings add a considerable amount of stress to an already stressful situation i wish we could tell you when the rain will end but we can t here s one thing we are sure of however the rain will end after that the sun will come out more than a million people would visit space city weather on sunday alone hurricane harvey already had a name now it had it face harvey s unrelenting rain left so much underwater like these orchard in pecan grove on tuesday evening more than four day after the rain first started to fall berger would finally write it s over he had been nearly perfect in his forecast it hadn t been all that windy so there weren t many roof blown off or tree toppled except in those few cursed place that were also visited by tornado and there wasn t much local storm surge the water didn t come rushing through houston it didn t arrive in wall the way it did in new orleans with katrina one of the reason harvey directly killed  people many in their car instead of an estimated   people many in their bed harvey wa a cataclysmic rain event just a berger had feared he could have been wrong and his reader would have moved their furniture back downstairs and grumbled about the wasted effort but he had been right and thousand of his reader didn t have a downstairs anymore a month after the storm berger dropped into his hyundai hybrid and went for a drive he wanted to see the terrible reality that had accompanied his forecast a though he could use the reminder that harvey really did do what it did to houston and to him by then the last part of weather analysis the accounting of the aftermath wa nearly complete it had rained so hard for so long that houston s swamp and reservoir and drainage canal filled up which meant that the city s kitchen and living room and den filled up next then the water drained away in the time in between it made an estimated   billion in property irreparably wet he headed south toward dickinson one of the worst hit area on some street every house had an enormous pile of debris out front everything that had been inside the house wa now outside of it rotting in the sun other street had been picked clean and they looked almost normal except that through their window berger could see that the otherwise pristine seeming house had been stripped down to the stud there wa a photograph that had made the round during the storm it wa of the flood soaked resident of a nursing home sitting on their lounger and walker water up to their chest it seemed like a macabre piece of surrealist art on his tour berger decided to visit that nursing home la vita bella nearly everything that wasn t human in that photograph wa now sitting out in the yard the lamp the chair and the popcorn machine from that haunting image melted in the pile of sodden sheetrock and carpet relic of a viral infamy they were joined by smaller but perhaps more significant loss a stuffed animal a deck of playing card a broken mirror a lipstick and a rouge a large print copy of marley amp me at   pm on sunday berger finished writing a post titled houston we will get through this berger had also lost a book in the flood before dawn on sunday lightning had lit up the sky and he could see that water had reached his garage he had mostly emptied one but not the other not the one that contained his old thing his diploma and his appetite for destruction poster and his box of book he raced down and lifted up a box from the floor and it bottom fell out a book titled from dawn to decadence by jacques barzun dropped into the water and disappeared berger had treasured that book a massive  year history of western civilization it french born author had died in texas in  barzun wa  year old and the book had been his life s work something about losing that particular book hit berger harder than it might have it wa a metaphor for how easily even our monument can be erased he had written about the loss of that book and other thing in a post that went up on ar technica early in the morning on august  the wednesday after the storm the post wa titled this is probably the worst u flood storm ever and i ll never be the same the cardboard box had failed he wrote and the book had dropped into the murk almost immediately a current from the rushing water beyond the garage door pulled the tome away forever damn i loved that book an indescribably bad night had just gotten that little bit worse berger started receiving email and note from his grateful reader they had saved some of their own treasure because of his warning and they felt they had a debt to settle a copy of from dawn to decadence wa eventually put into his hand by a stranger a woman who had attended a talk he had overcome his nerve to give after the storm that book now sits high and dry on a shelf in his office a tiny reminder of the thing that harvey had taken but also a reminder of the thing it had delivered the national weather service is part of a necessary and effective meteorological bureaucracy it is staffed by thousand of people by good and competent forecaster who care deeply about the weather and it effect on their community the nw can offer it best daily guess informed by their forecaster computer model and professional experience it can give warning and sound alarm but the nw can t talk about the weather the way human being talk about the weather it can t explore each of it uncertainty almost reveling in the sweeping possibility of hurricane and their animal behavior it can t riff more important when the weather is at it worst the national weather service can t comfort even though dan reilly and his colleague live and work in greater houston even though they were plenty concerned during harvey for their own family and home they can t issue a bulletin that say we re sick and tired of the rain just like everyone else they can t write the rain will end after that the sun will come out only someone like eric berger can do that providing a weather forecast that includes word like hope or sorry or maybe only someone like eric berger can employ our best technology in a way that still feel intimate and human scale applying the wisdom of satellite to deb walter and her doomed party only someone like eric berger looking out his window at the rain and willing for it to stop even though he know that it won t be stopping anytime soon can speak to a family watching the water on it torturous rise to their door the wind threatening the entirety of their life and make them feel a little le alone in the storm update after this article went to press we heard from deb walter one of the many people who sought berger s advice just before hurricane harvey thanks to berger s forecast walter decided to cancel a house party she host every year for some member of alcoholic anonymous and ex con it turned out to be a good call although walter house wa spared the surrounding street flooded which would have stranded the guest there for three day these folk are hysterical she said a in funny and lovable but the type of people you invite to a party aren t necessarily the type of people you want to spend three day with she finally hosted the shindig three week later for a smaller crowd the editor chris jones is a longtime magazine writer he also wrote about the international space station this article appears in the january issue subscribe now listen to this story and other wired feature on the audm app

column2: those loss continued on friday a mr trump promised a shutdown that will last a very long time put it together with disappointment over the federal reserve plan to keep raising interest rate and the market had one of it worst week in many year with the s amp p  down more than  percent mohammed hadi nine department will close the treasury a well a the department of agriculture homeland security the interior state housing and urban development transportation commerce and justice more than   people will work without pay including nearly   custom and border protection agent and   coast guard employee a traveler flood the nation airport and train station   t s a agent will keep working a will air traffic controller and aviation and railroad safety inspector another   worker will be furloughed the status of national park will be up in the air park staff would be furloughed although the park themselves would remain accessible however some park including the grand canyon are planning to stay open visa and passport service will continue a long a there are sufficient fee to support operation a department spokesman said but passport agency located in government building affected by a lapse in appropriation may become unavailable to the public catie edmonson

column2: zagster the bike share company behind the pace brand is launching what it s calling pace parking the idea is for it so serve a a parking platform for bike electric bike and electric scooter pace is first launching these in chicago austin and bloomington ind with the plan to launch in additional city this year this parking platform is designed to support dockless lock to vehicle like jump bike and skip scooter in partnership with city private landowner and local business the idea is to make sure community have proper parking infrastructure with the meteoric rise of dockless bike ebikes and scooter in the u s our city are now in the early stage of a massive transformation in how people get around one a significant a the personal automobile in th century zagster ceo tim ericson said in a statement imagine a city with ten of thousand of car and nowhere to park them this is the huge challenge faced by every major u s city right now without mobility parking infrastructure city have no solution to secure the flood of new vehicle descending upon their street and sidewalk and we are the first company to do something about it a the pioneer of lock to dockless bike sharing we re proud to deliver the first ever universal secure smart parking platform for parking not just pace bike but other shared bike personal bike electric scooter and future mobility vehicle earlier this year zagster raised a   million round led by edison capital partner the startup ha also unveiled it new bike parking system for both shared and personal bike bike have always locked to thing zagster ceo tim ericson said in a press release city have been willing to experiment with dockless bike that don t lock to anything because they lack sufficient bike parking and until pace lacked a partner willing to install this infrastructure at no cost zagster s pace is one of the newer entrant to the bike share space which consists of a number of startup and larger company battling for contract with city all over the world pace which launched in december currently operates in tallahassee florida and knoxville tennessee with the funding zagster plan to launch pace in additional city this year zagster also operates a bike share solution for municipality looking to offer their own city specific service zagster which launched in  operates more than  bike share across  state in the u s this column2: leave your smartwatch on the counter because timex is back with it first automatic watch in decade called the marlin this  jewel timepiece that hearkens back to the day of take a licking keep on ticking the marlin cost   and come in multiple style this particular model in a rich burgundy look like something that you d wear to a madison avenue cocktail party after work timex ha also released manual wind watch for   featuring a truly retro design and numeral timex ha long been a drug store brand a brand sold in those case at big drug store and aimed at impulse shopper who needed a watch any kind of watch while their indiglo line of bright light up quartz watch wa a long time hit they really didn t do much beyond making a few very basic piece for a non discerning audience now however the company clearly looked at it history and liked what it saw timex wa one of the first american watch brand to expand on a mass scale and they suffered greatly during the  quartz crisis a moment when the watch industry went from mechanical movement to electronic many watchmaker never recovered or are now a husk of their former glory hamilton for example but timex kept at it now that they ve given automatic and manual wind a try i m excited to see where they go next many watchmaker have noticed that men and woman are buying more and more retro watch to offset the creeping smartwatch flood i m glad to see the team at timex is ready to take on this fascinating new world
